Pretty good acting by all involved. Great action sequences, the car chase/driving scenes definitely was the highlight of this movie.

The plot and pacing of this movie were very formulated. You have seen this movie before and probably better done, Gone in Sixty Seconds rings a bell here and is a better movie.

Other than the unique mix of a soundtrack and how they integrated it into a tool for the character this was a pretty generic movie. If you go into it looking to be entertained and don't expect much from it you should have a good time.

title: Yet another movie for moviemakers.
review:
It ain't half bad; it might even be quite entertaining or emotional once you bond with the characters. Driving and music make it sort of all worth watching.
Actors do a decent job and girls look hot as hell.
Then again, it's just another movie for moviemakers to blow their load.
Cinematography - my God, Holmes! - really?
Music, choreography and dance - my God, Holmes!
Everyone is just genius - really?
Go and watch it, but don't go and blow your load all over it.

title: Good movie until the last 30 minutes start....
review: .... it becomes wreckfest of logic errors and sterotypes which destroyed the whole movie.

title: Capsule Review: Baby Driver
review: If there's one thing that Baby Driver gets right then it is the soundtrack, but this is no Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 1 where the soundtrack was relevant and enhanced the film's appeal. Here, the tracks are played randomly with the hope that just because they are catchy, upbeat, or generally hummable, they will have the audience hooked. Director and writer Edgar Wright carves a story that has no character background or development and depends on second-hand car chase sequences and cringe-worthy dialogues to keep his characters occupied. Chocolate boy Ansel Elgort plays the young and stylish version of the Transporter where he drives armed gangs to and from heist locations. With few stupid idiosyncratic reservations of his own just so to make himself look smart, he further annoys his audience with unmotivated actions and gets absorbed into a gummy romance written without an iota of imagination. You are to believe that his constant exposure to random music helps him maneuver cars better for there is no explanation as to how this taciturn kid with parental issues learned driving like a knife of butter. There's a hint somewhere, but of course Wright didn't think it was enough for an informed audience. He's a good kid, some of his characters say of him sometime in the film, but they miss the part about how irritating he is. Almost every other character has shades of absurdity that doesn't gel well with whatever the story is all about. Throwing Easter eggs about other popular heist movies does not and will not make a movie better. It at least has to have remarkable car chase sequences, witty dialogues, and a strong and substantial plot, none of which this film excels in. And the final 10 minutes are the worst I have seen all year. Baby Driver is a fast-paced drivel that can make even lovable actors like Jon Hamm and Jamie Foxx look poor in retrospect. I watched this after the news story about Kevin Spacey came out, and yes, it did negatively impact my experience. But Baby Driver has bigger issues. TN.

title: WE HAVE OFFICIALLY ENTERED THE DARK AGES
review:
Every time I think Hollywood has finally stopped treating its audiences as cave people, it does it again! Baby Driver is no exception.

It's plot is devastatingly haphazard, its character development exceptionally bland, and its length was 2 hours too long.

I am often incredibly awe-inspired by humanity's creations, the complexity of the human mind, the achievements of our prolific peers. We have sent people to the moon, we have cities with 100% electric powered public transport, we have saved lives with incredibly intricate STEM cell based transplant procedures. And then, we have creations like Baby Driver, which has single handedly offset the progress of our ancestors in advancing humanity. We have officially, ladies and gentlemen, entered the Dark Ages once more.

title: okay but done before
review:
Baby (Ansel Elgort) is a boyish, young man caught up in Atlanta's crime scene. As he is indebted to a crime-lord (Kevin Spacey), his expert driving skills are exploited as a getaway driver for various robberies. Baby would eventually like to go "straight" but the crime-lord won't allow this.

"Baby Driver" is a competent film: the story is consistent and sometimes exciting; the acting is good; the main character is interesting; the car chases and criminal showdowns are well done; and it has a superb soundtrack (Baby has to constantly listen to music due to a traumatic incident in his childhood).

With all the praise in the above paragraph, a rating of at least three stars should be in order. But it goes down a half notch for a couple of reasons. As a film that is dependent on car chases and shoot-'em-ups, "Baby Driver" would inevitably be compared to the hundreds of others that have already been done in this genre. More unique films that advance this well-worn genre would deserve a three-star rating or higher. While not quite formulaic, "Baby Driver"'s depth goes only so far. Had it been more substantial, I might have given the film a higher rating.

title: Yet a movie with exaggerated praises
review: I watched this movie after reading tons of good reviews from many source. I expected it to be a wonderful mix of John Wick, Fast & Furious, and Guardian of the Galaxy vol 1 (in term of music). I was wrong. Its first 10 minutes was jaw-dropping and exciting, but that was it. The rest of the movie felt into cliché, cringing details (in an extremely bad way) which did not make any sense! A baby-face driver has an instant crush with a blondie, a good-looking guy with a hot Mexican chick, a black guy who appear to be a pain in the ass and can't stop bragging, and the only spotlight of the movie: a calm mastermind who decided to be good guy in the end with a can't-be-more-dumb reason. Everything is wrong with this movie. Even the ending of it fails to make any sense. Seriously, I just don't get why people loves this movie!

title: A playlist doesn't make a movie...
review:
The movies runs on the playlist of songs and nothing more. It lives on the selection of songs and creates short scenes accompanying them. But there is nothing that holds it together.

Edgar Wright desperately tries to be Tarantino with this but he isn't close to being as talented as Tarantino is. All in all the movie wants to be edgy and cool, which makes it just uncool.

The movie is like the annoying friend of your teens you don't wanna hang out with, but he keeps calling you and you give in now and then because he has all the cool new music and a car.

The soundtrack in the end is better than the movie. Beside that this is a fluffy little crime thriller centered and edited around a playlist. And this is what people mostly rate: the soundtrack and not the movie.

I give this movie 2 out of 10. Two more points for the song selection making it a 4 in the end. You are better advised to get the playlist on Spotify and listening to it while doing something else instead of watching this movie.

title: Bad Baby, easy driving.
review: Baby Driver has a fantastic sense of momentum. From walking down a block to evading the police in a high stakes chase, everything Baby does is well choreographed and high impact. The opening heists serve both as the best action sequences in the film, and as a clever framing technique to introduce a colorful and twisted cast of criminals. Unfortunately most every character in this film ends up revolving too close to the titular Baby, making them seem like mirrors for the protagonist's ego, rather than fulfilling their potential as great characters in their own right. This is my only real problem with the film. Lily James and CJ Jones seem crammed into the script only to smile and repeatedly tell Baby how great he is, while Kevin Spacey also has an overabundance of ass kissing lines, although he delivers most of them with a scowl. What makes this all so infuriating is that while Baby is a fun character, and his Tinnitus is wonderfully incorporated into the editing, he doesn't seem worthy of the fascination the script has with him. It is a fun joyride nonetheless, but I can't help but feeling that if Baby Driver had utilized its excellent cast of criminals better, it could have been more than that.

title: I too don't understand how this is so highly rated
review:
I'm being generous with the stars. But I've seen so many poorly made movies this year. That this at least excels in some aspects.

The chase sequences were pretty cool, and I would say a lot more plausible/realistic than many movies. Where you could see if someone was that good in reality they might actually get away. On a technical level it had a lot going for it. So I will give it that.

The biggest disbelief in this film is the story. It's a bit silly. The main actor while he could dance, had good looks, and do a parkour move over the car. The whole time. I thought was a pretty terrible actor. Made me wonder who chose this kid for the role? When the love story rolled around, I could not wait for it to get back to the action. I suppose he would make for a good dj too. But not an actor.

It was like Baby was trying to do a bad ass hip Napoleon Dynamite? The girl at the diner instantly became the most supportive girlfriend ever with very little history or investment to risk her whole life. But OK.

The acting by the supporting cast was very good. But again the story is just silly.

If the director would make an action edit, without the whole love story. Limited to just the kid driving the heist, not trying to act.Just the supporting actors, it would be good, maybe even a 7.4 How this kid got the leading role is beyond me. Must have some connections in Hollywood some studio exec wanted to make his son happy?

Watch if your bored, or are highschool age or younger.

title: Original and well made, but the ending is such a disaster
review:
With very unique soundtrack, film edit, cast, the ending twist is such a waste of such a good movie !

I was about to rate it with a 9, but the last 20-25 minutes of it convinced me that the producers/writers wanted this film to end like all the other cliché action/cars/shooting/etc films that we have all got used to (and bored of). Such a waste ! They have made it almost perfectly, but the ending is so bad...

Ansel Elgort, I have never heard of him before, but his performance in this....it rocks. I think we will hear from him soon and I can see some good films with him in the near future !

title: A Mixed Bag
review: Well the start was pretty good.. but as the plot unfolds the story starts getting haywire, The acting was good but all the old school robbing, running,car chases are quite a lot to digest in this smartphone era where you can be tracked almost from everywhere, it was quite cinematic. But nevertheless It's a nice change of pace from all the fantasy and sci-fi superheroes flicks. It's definitely a one time watch. I was about to rate it 6 but then again one point for all the great songs.

title: Not what I expected from Edgar Wright...
review: I love Shaun, Nick Angel, Scott Pilgrim. They are really awesome! & so funny by the way. I carry my expectation to "The World's End" and yeah, its OK. So, after all the buzz, the hype and good critics, my expectation is way too high too for this movie. Its my fault to expect a perfect movie, "Baby Driver" is just a good, cool and stylized action movie. Its OK overall, I like it. I guess this movie will appeal more well to American audience because they know all the old song that have been played in the movie. They might enjoy it better than people from other continent that's not very familiar with the song selection. I love some of the song too but in some scene I think its too much and kind of annoying when its so loud with the help of the cinema audio system. Enough said, just enjoy it, its OK. If you ask me the "stuff" that I expected from this movie. I just expect some "hot fuzz" kind of stuff. What can I do? I just love that movie very much.

title: Fun Movie - Style Over Substance
review:
I saw Baby Driver twice. The first time, I really left feeling ambiguous about it. I overwhelmingly felt like the lack of plot detracted from the quality of them movie.

The second time I watched it, I actually enjoyed it. This is Edgar Wright doing what he does best. The movie is highly stylistic and almost the entire movie is set to music. The action, the dialogue, nearly everything is in time with a song or a drum solo or a guitar riff. The acting is good, for the most part. Kevin Spacey is always exceptional - he seems to excel at playing somewhat devious characters. Ansel is very charismatic, and though he doesn't actually speak much during this film, he still commands attention and you develop an affection for his character. My only issue is with his love interest. Debora is, as female characters tend to be, only there to further Baby's plot line. Their chemistry makes sense, but her complete willingness to run away with a person entrenched in a world of crime that she barely knows really bothered me. I still left feeling as though the plot was substandard, but it didn't really matter. This movie is not about the plot, it is about the experience. There are breathtaking car chase scenes and just generally excellent cinematography. The color schemes are poignant and deliberate, and the consistent music supplies the tone and pace for every scene. Overall, I would say this movie is worth a watch. Just don't go in expecting a heavily plot driven movie or a ton of character development.

title: Alluring, Amusing & Appeasing, But It Could've Been So Much More
review: A smart, stylish & sophisticated extravaganza from Edgar Wright that's crafted with passion, pierced with sharp wit, features a vibrant set of characters who are expertly brought to life by its colourful cast, and packs a whole lot of swag that goes along perfectly with its stupefying car chases, thrilling gunslinging action & a groovy soundtrack that always plays the right track at the right time, Baby Driver is one of the coolest films to come out this year, and is as original as it is invigorating.

title: Typical "modern" nonsense
review:
Stupid characters and a stupid story mixed with an oldschool soundtrack (because that worked on Guardians Of The Galaxy) and a high pace screenplay.
And not to forget the "Boy with a hard life meets supermodel at a burger-grill" blabla...
Bad jokes and lines throughout the hole movie, irrational ways cops get disctracted etc.
One of the worst latest movies i watched.
And it is scary that this movie is rated that high.

title: Baby Driver
review: "Baby Driver" is the modern car chase that people of all generations would enjoy. There is action, comedy, love, family and tragedy. Also, if you are someone who loves music, all types. Then this movie is a must-see. The movie is about 2 hours and about 20 minutes of the film consists on no music. Due to Baby, played by Ansel Egort, always having earbuds in, the story is told from his point-of-view. If he has headphones in, the the audience will hear the same song he is listening to. In one scene, Baby and his fellow criminal associates, played by Jon Hamm, Jamie Foxx, and Eiza Gonzalez are sent to pick up weapons from a friend of Doc, played by Kevin Spacey. Jamie Foxx's character Bats, goes crazy and starts shooting all of Doc's weapons traders. Baby avoids and hides although he listening to the song "Tequila" and the movement of the fight, the sound of the guns and the overall movement is matched and choreographed perfectly to the sounds of the song. In the scene, there were tons of shots in the about 1-2 minutes scene because of all the action and noise going on and the fast paced song. Although, Baby is disappointed because he meets a young woman, Deborah played by Lily James. Baby now realizes that he wants out of the life of crime and being the get-away driver for Doc and live a white- picket fence family life with Deborah. Unfortunately, Baby has to find a way out to keep the love of his life. Baby is almost a mute. He rarely speaks and even mentions in the movie that he has talked to Deborah more in one night than anyone else all year. To see his how Deborah has changed him into the better person and allows him to become more vocal about getting out of crime and loving her and do whats good for society rather than steal. He changes for the better and it happens at a good pace. Baby does everything to protect Deborah from getting involved with these people. That is why some people have died, so Baby can protect Deborah. Whenever Deborah is around, a song filled with happiness and love is there. When Baby is driving and getting away, the song is fast paced and when he is just walking around, it is a calm and unemotional song. The whole movie is a 2 hour soundtrack. Once again, for anyone who loves music, this is an amazing movie. It is one of my top 10.

title: best film of 2017
review:
Go watch Baby Driver- the best film of the year till date.

Baby Driver is a unique movie, creates its own category- that of a heist musical. Yes, you read it right, and let me explain. At its core, Baby driver is as old school as it gets- it is about rollicking car chases and near crazy criminals. Juxtapose that background on the central character, Baby, who is a demon of a getaway car driver, and who views life through music, and there you have a heist musical- an exhilarating experience I must say. No superhero or transforming robot big bashes, just a straight forward stylishly made romantic action comedy running on gallons of nitrous oxide.

Was he slow?

So what is unique about Baby, played by an excellent Ansel Elgort? He makes remixes out of everyday conversations, and turns his world into music. He is addicted, nay dependent, on music because of his tinnitus condition- he needs to play music to cancel out the continuous ringing in his ears. So director Edgar Wright takes this a step further to make everyday activity a part of Baby's soundtrack. Everything that happens in the movie- a car rushing past, a man typing, a message coming on the phone- will work with the beats, in a fluidic way that is almost impossible to imagine, let alone execute. Hats off to Mr. Wright then.

But its not all style, there is tons of substance too. Baby in the past tried to rob Doc (Kevin Spacey), got caught and now is trying to pay off his debt by being the driver for the heists that Doc plans. One last job is what he is due, but once you are in crime, there is no last job so there is that. And then he meets Debora (Lily James), the love of his life, the reason to get out of crime. Do the stars align? Is Baby able to turn a new leaf? Do the lovebirds get to walk away in the sunset? All this to the tune of Jon Spencer Blues Explosion, Bob & Earl, The Beach Boys, Queen, Simon & Garfunkel T. Rex, Beck and many more.

The stars do an exceptional job too. Ansel Elgort and Lily James embody an old world chemistry and charisma. Spacey is Spacey- super cool, Jamie Foxx as Bats is scary, Jon Hamm and Eiza Gonzales as lovers in crime are great, while CJ Jones as Baby's foster father brings tons of sensitivity to a 100 mph movie. In fact it is not only about the stars. Every one- the extras, the bits and pieces actors perform like flawless beats in a chart topping soundtrack.

Baby Driver is what movies are all about. Awesome music- check. Great plot- check. Excellent direction- check. Superb acting- check. Flaws in the movie- nil. Don't believe? Watch it and find out.

title: Get Set....MUSIC......Go
review: The movie starts off well the car chase was amazing and the same carries over through, I was skeptical for first 30mins due to the songs playing almost all the time in the background but they were just perfect for the story and action sequences so much so that one cannot imagine this movie without them. This is a very nicely crafted movie and very well directed one, there were are few scenes where things might have been different but at the end of the day, you would be very satisfied spending the time watching it. Nice to see Kevin Spacey in a good role and the lead actor did his job well, lead actress choice might have been better other cast members did a decent job But it's not the perfect movie though with that said do watch it and you will be entertained.

title: Pure show or 21st century western
review: Good action movie with a protagonist (Baby) of enigmatic and magnetic personality and an outstanding soundtrack. There is suspense, emotion and very good scenes of persecution; only Kevin Spacey does not seem the actor appropriate to the script, his performance is impersonal and unconvincing, nevertheless it is obscured by the rest of actors and in general by the whole show.

title: Loved it.
review: This was such a surprise to watch. I had no real concept of the movie and watched it with my 17 yo son who really enjoyed it too. Fantastic visually and musically. I also love the fact that CGI took a backseat. Kevin Spacey was really good at being bad, with a twist. Jamie Foxx freaked me out, I just wanted to see him get a bullet. John Hamm was good too, needs to work on his menacing stare technique a bit. The guy who played Baby was just excellent. I really felt for him and his predicament. I'll happily call this one of my favourites.

title: Fun Summer Movie
review:
Coming from a sort-of dry summer in the likes of movies, this was a diamond in the rough. I went to this movie right after seeing the new Spider-Man and actually enjoyed Baby Driver so much more.

I am a huge fan of music and the only people who will not like this movie are the people who do not like music all too much. The whole movie is basically a music video and they show that in multiple ways by having Baby stop his crew so he could start the song at the right time or subtly having lyrics appear on the scene as he is walking.

The greatest part about this movie was that the chase scenes were not choppy and hard to watch, which is typical in a car movie. They are actually really smooth and easy to follow. Characters are lovable and there is almost nothing wrong with this movie.

ALMOST. There is one or two things that bothered me and this wouldn't be a good review if I didn't address them. #1- The Love aspect: The movie has a waitress that Baby falls for. That OK, but she falls for him way too fast and barely blinks an eye when he kills someone. Most people would not fall for somebody so hard, and that quick, that they would watch someone kill a guy and then run away with them. #2- Jamie Foxx's character sucked. He played it well but overall, the character was really overplayed and a cliché to say the best.

Still a great movie. Watch ASAP.

Gavin Johns, wanna-be critic, sk8teboard11@gmail.com

title: A romantic and crazy film
review:
This is the movie that made me mind-blowing, director did a great job this time,'Baby driver' is one of the best movie of 2017.

Actors made a great interaction, and Jon Hamm is awesome, of course we need to talk about how Ansel did a excellent performance this time.

As for the action, the car-chasing scene is absolutely breathtaking. I can feel the fast and furious while the chase. I love the opening scene.The music made the movie become better, it make sure we'll not feel bored while Baby's driving.

title: Way too cool !
review: This movie is way too cool to be discarded or treated like trash ..especialy if you realise your in front a work of Art ! The flow of this movie is pure and simple sinc genius , music ,sound , movement ...it all blends in perfect harmony , creating a wonderful flow of magic and amazement ... Great direction (reminds me of directing a musical) ...good budget! Fantastic editing ! Wonderful actors (imprevesible interactions) ...fun fun fun ! The perfect team work ! Great moment ...Loved it !

title: What a heist movie should be..
review:
Baby Driver by Edgar Wright (Shaun Of The Dead, Hot Fuzz, World's End, Scott Pilgrim) is one thing first and foremost: a lot of action, pace and fun.

Ansel Elgort (weird last name, can't get over it) plays a younger getaway driver with a tragic past. Kevin Spacey plays the boss, Jon Hamm and the hot Eiza Gonzalez are a Bonnie and Clyde-type couple, Jamie Foxx a trigger-happy lowlife criminal with Jon Bernthal rounding up the bunch of criminals. Lily James is the main characters' love interest. Altogether, a very good cast.

Adding Mr. Wright's directing skills and a great soundtrack and you got yourself a very entertaining heist movie. There are hardly any boring moments, which is very essential and the scenes involving cars and driving (a very big part of the movie) are terrific. I can't remember the last time I enjoyed car chases as much in a movie.

Great entertainment. 7.4/10

title: One of the best in a long long time
review:
Watch this without watching a single trailer of it. Initially thought it was a baby driving the car.

I'm one of the few never like car chasing cause I think all the movies' car chasing actions are more or less the same. I wouldn't say there a lot of different here but I like it how it fits in the movie.

I like music but unable to adapt the how it fits in most movies but Baby Driver perfected it. I enjoyed every second of the show.

There is more than 3 possibilities leading to the end but at least there is more predictions. Bonding, happy ending, goes nothing or got everything. Nothing better than a meaningful ending which I thought it will be bad but turned out great.

Get some popcorn and enjoy the movie at its best 2hrs.

title: Baby Driver is the most stylish films of the year
review: Edgar Wright redefines the genre of action movies with the best soundtrack of the year, with fantastic cinematography and a compelling, fast-paced story. Ansel Elgort plays the perfect Baby, and Lily James is stellar as Debora. There are few weak moments, and it makes for a good action film that can be considered one of Wright's best films.

title: A masterpiece in editing
review:
Baby Driver is a very unconventional movie in today's world. It is very rare to see a fully original script with a great director and a beautiful style.

I loved Baby Driver, it is such a good time and everything about it is almost perfect. The "Gimmick" (It is not really a gimmick) of the movie is that everything in the movie is in beat with a song that "Baby" (main character) is playing in his iPod. This creates some excellent scenes were a lot is happening, yet everything is perfectly on beat.

Production wise, this movie is a 10/10. Every aspect of the production of this movie is great. Actually, I believe this movie should win an Oscar for "Best Editing", it would be a crime not to. This movie has the challenge of keeping everything on beat, and that is primarily done through editing, it is amazing to see how almost everything is following a song, and you don't even notice.

The Cinematography is also outstanding. Edgar Wright uses some very cool shots to film the action scenes, in which you can see everything. There are also some very good one-shot scenes that have a lot of hidden messages waiting for you to find.

I must give credit to Edgar Wright for using actual cars and stunt-men rather than CGI for the car chases, they feel so real and everything is shut perfectly for you to see what is happening.

Of course, the soundtrack is amazing. It contains a lot of great Rock and Blues songs.

Story wise, this movie is also great. The characters are very interesting and well rounded. All the supporting cast was super fun to see on screen and the main character was very interesting by himself. I specially like the character of "Buddy" and all the things he does at the end. Kevin Spacey is remarkably hilarious in his role and gives some great one-liners.

There is some comedy sprinkled through the movie (typical for Edgar Wright), and it almost always lands, he has a lot of experience doing comedy (When I say sprinkled I don't mean that it is very few, I am saying that you shouldn't expect something like Hot Fuzz or World's End where every scene has a joke in it).

The only problem I had with the movie was the love interest. The story was pretty interesting and there was a lot of chemistry between the characters. I just feel that there was not enough time devoted to them and when they have to make important decisions for each other, it just seems like we skipped some scenes were they bonded a lot more. My theory is that there were some scenes that were cut out that provided the romance with more screen time.

It is rare for me to say it, but I actually recommend you to watch this movie twice, because there are a lot of hidden secrets that you will not find in the first one, but will find in the second viewing. I certainly enjoyed the movie more the second time I saw it.

title: So fun!
review: Having read some of the negative reviews, I guess I get where they're coming from intellectually. But this movie is just so fun! Forget plot holes, forget character development, and just go along for the ride. This is the most fun I've had at the movies for a long time. The music is amazing. Baby is adorable. I LOVE this movie and have recommended it to many friends. The only thing I would be careful about -- the violence is extreme and over the top. But it's so crazy that it becomes part of the comedy in my opinion. But if you're someone who is sensitive to violence, this movie is not for you.

title: Dynamic
review:
Baby Driver or Baby: The Apprentice of the Crime

A talented driver, Baby (Ansel Elgort), a criminal gang, headed by Doc (Kevin Spacey), want to get out of this criminal life to have a normal life with Deborah (Lily James).

Let's start with the actors. Ansel Elgort falls like ring to the finger to this movie, I couldn't imagine anyone else doing this role. As with Kevin Spacey, because the character she plays... is Kevin Spacey. Is the interpreting itself. Is this wrong? No... is the best part of the movie. Like Jon Hamm, the best of the film.

The film is super hyper dynamic, you cannot close the eyes at any moment in the film. Or if you do not have to re-read it.

A great direction, under the command of Edgar Wright, which forces you to look at all the time the screen.

The action is dynamic with a very moving story, and funny sometimes. What makes a movie many enjoyable.

The music in impeccable. Impeccable With the protagonist. With the action. But in some moments of the movie I drowned the music. But I think that was the idea. But to me it bothered me.

If you are going to see a movie that I have a very deep meaning in a movie, this is not such a film. With this comes to see how to kill Kevin Spacey a bunch of times, not to win the Oscar for best film.

Dynamic 9/10

title: AKA: How to make a BAD copy of an existing movie
review:
Take the plot of Drive, but reduce it to the superficial part of it. Make a movie based on a soundtrack, but use boring songs. Make it a parody kind of movie 'cause you know it won't be a serious one, but never get the kind of humor the Guardians of Galaxy can reach. Finally, take good actors, Kevin Spacey on all of them, to reach not the bottom of 1/10 reviews. Made it.

From a fan of the genre, super fan of Drive, was the most disappointing movie of the year.

title: A Spinning Record
review:
A very steady directing hand by Edgar Wright. Music is the sync of life and he plays it to the hilt about a driver for crimes because...he's indebted to a crime boss. Simple enough. Until you introduce nutjobs.

Quirky fun and clearly a filmmaker who knows how to put together a movie that isn't trying to be so computer graphics heavy. What a relief it is to watch a movie where you see the director's personality in it rather than stupid superheroes being thrown through drywall. God, I hate Marvel. Anyway, the ending looks like they ran out of money. But the movie is fun enough, and I hope it does well, because we need more movie makers who know how to make movies.

title: One of the Best Blockbusters of the Year
review:
I think this is what the people should think when they talk about a summer blockbuster. An entertaining movie but also a good movie, not just some CGI creatures destroying a random city and nothing more. This movie offers a very good entertainment and a very good story and for me it will probably be one of the best blockbusters of the year, along with Dunkirk and the third planet of the apes movie.

It tells us the story of Baby (Ansel Elgort), a boy who suffered an accident when he was young and because of that he is always listening to music that helps him relax and so. He is the driver of Doc (Kevin Spacey) who gets him to drive some bank robberies. Well, maybe it's not very well explained but I'm sure it's worth the watch. The story it's not just car chases and bank robberies. It also has time for developing the human side of the characters, at least of some of them, because the other are merciless and cruel. It reminded me to the movie Drive starring Ryan Gosling in the sense that the main character is a driver who does not speak much and the things he does are trying to do the right thing.

The cast was wonderful. Ansel Elgort as the main character, Baby, was perfect. He has this shy even emotionless face in some parts but he also has the human side in his relationship with the old man, Joseph, and with Debora, Lily James. She was also very good in the role as the love interest of Baby. The love story, I thought would be just an excuse to get more people to the cinema but it's very well introduced and developed. They have a great chemistry and at many times you really feel the same they feel. The secondary characters were also great, from Jaime Foxx as Bats, to Kevin Spacey as Doc, they all have little moments to shine, to make you hate them or love them.

And now I have to talk about the visuals. This is one of the best things of this movie. How the action sequences were filmed. Edgar Wright was able to give this movie the feeling he wanted. To make you feel tense, in danger, until the very end of the movie. There are many car chases and a chase running by the street and they all are filmed amazingly. And with this you have the soundtrack. Steven Price has a small score but here the important things are the songs. It's not a cheap excuse to introduce the songs. You have Baby's backstory as an explanation and the songs are just like another character in the movie. I have to mention not only Edgar Wright but also the music and film editors who managed to synchronize the music with the action sequences, with the gunshots, with the car chases, and gave a special feeling to the film.

I totally recommend you this if you like heist movies, action movies, thriller movies, and even musical movies, because this is some kind of action-thriller musical movie that should be the kind of movies that we should have every summer, not just Transformers or Fast & Furious movies. Just watch it and see it for yourself but I'm sure you will probably enjoy it as well as I did.

title: "Baby Driver": One-Sentence Reviews
review:
"Baby Driver": One-Sentence Review

With the help of an all-star cast and a perfectly synced soundtrack, Edgar Wright, who's made a career of turning genre films on their head ("Shaun of the Dead," "Hot Fuzz"), directs a convention-blurring, career-defining masterpiece in "Baby Driver."

11.5 out of 12 Tamales

For more one-sentence reviews, checkout tamalemoviereviews.com

title: I would give it an A+
review:
Note, I am not a professional film critic. I wouldn't write a review if I didn't have to, I would just give a grade and be done with it.

After seeing this movie with a group of friends, one of them said: "Every frame of this movie was made to entertain." I couldn't agree more. I loved every second of this movie. Amazing acting, amazing editing, amazing characters and amazing music. I'm a big Edgar Wright fan and this only cements it. No film is perfect and with this my problem is there is a certain plot point that never goes anywhere, Jon Bernthal is wasted talent (he is barely in the film) and I think there are a few too many scenes of people praising Baby. But other than that the film is super close to perfect and I would watch it anytime.

Favorite Scene: When Intermission by Blur starts to play, as well as the chase scene after it. On the edge of my seat the whole time.

A+

title: Groovy Babyy
review:
Director Edgar Wright is in a league of his own. I have always been a fan of his movies, especially the three flavors cornetto trilogy. With Baby Driver, Wright adds one more feather to his cap by directing this heist action comedy. Oh wait, it can also be categorized musical.

Baby Driver is about a young driver named Baby who works for a criminal boss to help him and his team finish a job. Things take a sharp turn, when Baby finds the love of his life and decides to quit what he is doing. Things are not as easy as they seem, as he has to go against his evil boss, weird heist crew and the law. Of course, Baby Driver has car chase sequences and are superbly shot. But what makes the action better is the music paired along with that. Music Director Steven Price has put out some classics which play mainly as a part of Baby's iPod playlist. The gunfights and combat sequences are quite similar to the ones from previous Edgar Wright movies and it is total fun.

This film is completely character driven. Each character is unique in its own way just like their names. Ansel Elgort as Baby has delivered his best without even having to say many dialogues. The current young generation can relate to his character so much as someone who just want to plug earphones and forget the rest of the world. Jon Hamm as buddy looks very stylish. Kevin Spacey as doc cakewalks through his cool antagonist role. Jamie Foxx is definitely a standout with his impromptu and crazy character called Bats.

Baby driver is a clear example of how one can make a good movie with just well written characters and wicked film making. This will definitely go down as a classic in years to come.

title: Shakespearian re-write of 'The Fast and Furious'. Cool. Elegant. Violent. Music from the Connoisseur Class of the 70s & 80s
review: I watched this film this evening. It is elegant and cool. But also violent and gripping. It's as if Shakespeare were still alive and he'd rewritten 'The Fast and the Furious' in the style of Titus Andronicus. He also secured, as you would expect, a top drawer cast. It is, for the most part, delightfully economical with dialogue and yet Nigella like in its generous helpings of music from the connoisseur class of the 70s and 80s. Some very slightly more obscure pieces you wouldn't find selected for a 'Bill and Ted' standard Hollywood movie. It won't be to everyone's taste, but I thought it was one of the best films I've seen in years. I've come home to see 2001: A Space Odyssey is on, with which it shares some elements of style in presentation. Anyway, many will think the film is worth the price of the ticket just for the opening prologue!

title: Fantastic and very entertaining
review: No doubt this may end up being the studio surprise of the year. It's not difficult to think of Drive when watching this. Just like Drive, its opening car chase scene and the subsequent credits opening are simply fantastic and set the mood for the entire thing. The real star of this film is Edgar Wright, who I haven't seen show this much directing flair and skill in quite a while, if not his entire career. This may truly be his best film yet. The screenplay is quite good and does a nice job with these characters, but it's everything else that seems to really bang. Elgort is so fantastic that you forget how unlikable his real life persona is. This is a fantastic film that should no doubt be recommended.

title: one of the better flicks of 2017
review:
Promising trailer made me go watch Baby Driver. Also stated as the blockbuster of the summer of 2017. Once it hit the theaters over here it was soon gone and it never became what it was promised and did remind me of last years summer failure, also called the blockbuster, Suicide Squad (2016). I agree, Suicide Squad did fail as a flick but Baby Driver didn't for me.

But I can understand all the writings about it because it isn't a 'normal' flick. It do has all elements of a suspenseful flick. But it's the excellent or even exquisite editing combined with the score that do annoy a lot of people but if you can dig that then you are into a really fine flick. The score used never bothered me, there are even a few surprises in it for me like The Damned (Neat Neat Neat). The shootings throughout the flick edited on the music made it for me a delight to see. Must have taken a lot of patience to do that.

Nevertheless, the opening scene with the car chase is a must see and it one of the best seen in years. Another surprise are the brands of cars that they are using. There's something for everybody from German cars to old US cars to Japanese cars to even the newest muscle cars.

I found it a stunning flick with superb cinematography and editing. Naturally the use of all those songs did remind me of Guardians Of The Galaxy (2014) were the score was also a main thing. And for the older viewers, yes it's cassette galore, those good old Maxells from the eighties. One of the better flicks of 2017.

Gore 0/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 3/5 Story 3/5 Comedy 0/5

title: Awesome
review: I watched the movie sitting on a chair and having lollipops. after 5 lollipops the movie ended, it ended pretty well. I loved the old fashioned way Baby Driver was designed. The team he worked together with seemed pretty cool. The music was fabulous and the movie may be rated as an action, thriller, romantic and musical in my point of view

title: Best two hours of my life!
review: Coming out of this movie I thought that those last two hours of my life were AWESOME! The action sequences and killing were fast paced and had happened right on time; especially for the opening and ending scenes as those moments were simultaneously insane and engaging. I also adored the cinematography and editing that went with this movie. And the best part: the whole movie is set to an awesome soundtrack! I would advocate this movie to anyone who's into this much fun as I was.

title: Summer Fun
review: If Drive, True Romance, Grand Theft Auto 5 and Jackie Brown had a Baby in 2017, this is what it would look, feel and sound like. The most fun I've had, watching a movie, since Chef. And you should know how much I loved Chef, but it's a different (testosterone driven) kinda fun.Great role for Ansel, who might be his generations Tom Cruise. The best Hamm has been on the big screen. Vintage Spacey and return to form for Foxx. And welcome to the show to both Lily James and Eiza Gonzalez. They'll both be around for a while. Perhaps the perfect summer movie at this point in time. Make sure you see it on the big screen with the big sound, but please be careful how you drive on your way home.

title: Awful
review:
What was Lily James thinking of when she agreed to do this?
Awful film.

title: Boooring!
review: Such a boring movie! Didnt want to watch it for a year, brcause the plot was not interesting. At least watched it, so I better didnt. Sleeping long plot, waste of time.

title: fine action made cool
review:
Baby (Ansel Elgort) is the skilled getaway driver for robberies organized by Doc (Kevin Spacey). Baby has hearing problems after the crash that killed his parents. He is constantly listening to music to alleviate the symptoms. He owes money to Doc and is working it off. Doc recruits a rotating cast of characters in the robbery crew. Baby falls for waitress Debora (Lily James).

Edgar Wright is the real star of the movie. The idea is pretty simple. The story is straight forward. The execution is superb. The car chases are fun with an exciting music soundtrack. There is his trademark close-ups but he doesn't do his usual long sequences. The acting is solid but Baby can be a distancing character. He says little and that is a wall from him at times. The rotating cast of characters also prevent great relationships from building up. Some of them have great scenes with him but they don't all have the needed time. Jon Bernthal has a great time poking at Baby but he's cut short. These are stylistic choices that probably pull back some of the bigger payoffs. While this is a fun execution, Baby is not a character who is bigger than the story. He's not quite at the same level as Ryan Gosling in Drive. It's partly Elgort. He's more a puppy version of the big dog. There are some fun moments. The comedy is sporadic but good. Overall, this is a fun ride.

title: Same old item
review: There is nothing new in this movie . Just overrated. Not too much boring but boring.

title: This was a terrible, terrible movie
review:
I'm going to keep this short as mentally revisiting this film causes me physical pain.

Insipid characters, plot holes, gaudy styling, weird pacing and not that much driving? I am confronted and confused by this film's positive reception.

The film's whole shtick is that it places both its score and driving in its engine room, but fails to use them effectively at all, leaving the final product as a weird and ugly Grease/Fast and Furious straight-to-VHS hybrid .

The characters were shallow and unlikable, with their motivations being either overly simple or completely arbitrary. Did not pass the Bechdel test, or even the Turing test to be honest, did a robot write these characters based on what it thought human's are?

I am still angered by the ending. Baby went to prison and then presumably was released after five years on parole, cut to a scene of him leaving the prison to meet Debora out the front dressed as a 50's pin up girl (for no discernible reason) standing next to a very expensive looking retro car, with the entire movie up to that point being set in the present day. How about trying to shove more artificially sweetened nostalgia down our throat Edgar Wright?

I could go on but I'd rather never think about this film again.

title: Trying to be too cool
review: Too many inspirations are thrown at the same time into that movie resulting in a lack of character development and original thinking among other things. Main character performance is dull in front of that experienced cast. Good enough for a Sunday evening while cooking in the background but that's it!

title: Was he slow?(No)
review:
This is yet another classic example I would point to when I say that a film is defined by its achievements and not by its flaws.

What Edgar Wright was able to pull off in "Baby Driver" was beyond impressive. I couldn't help but notice the amount of work he put in to sync everything in the film's universe to the music; the use of the soundtrack is super original and unique. You know generally which direction the story is going, but things happen in unexpected ways which keeps you on your toes. The film maintains a breakneck pace throughout as his films tend to do, and it never lets up from the opening chase scene. The cinematography, stuntwork and screenplay are all amazing and help distinguish the film's personality even more.

The performances were all stellar; I only had a couple of issues, one being Jamie Foxx. His character was presented as a hard and crazy criminal, yet his performance seemed far too tame for this to be convincing. I don't exactly understand what the intent behind this was, perhaps it is something I can think about more on a second watch.

My other issue was with Lily James as Debora. At times, it felt like she was reduced to this unbearably bland sidekick girlfriend character. Plus, she was given some of the most cheesy lines ever. This has way more to do with the writing than the actual acting, though.

Another minor criticism I have, the last 15 minutes felt quite underwhelming. It seemed as though Edgar Wright had no idea how to resolve the story he had built up in a memorable way, and the end of the movie was just for the sake of ending the movie. Somewhat disappointing.

Overall, though, this film is pretty amazing throughout.

title: How to do a car movie right
review: This movie shows that you can do amazing practical stunts with out a lot of cgi. I love Edgar right and the way he directs. He is definitely one of the best directors working today. I don't understand the people who say that this movie is bad. They must really hate good cinema. Definitely check this movie out if you have the chance.

title: The Best Introverted ADHD Movie Ever
review:
With a title like that, you're either immediately drawn to the movie, or you didn't even make it to the first line of this review. Welcome to the former!

I did not expect to love this movie, as much as I did. But I could relate to the main character, I too love to lose myself behind a pair of headphones, just to observe the soundtrack of life. I love high energy set to good vibes. And though I don't always make the best choices, but I desire to do the right thing.

Baby, the movie's main character, drives fast and furious, for some dubious bank robbing thugs. But all for a good cause. To payoff a debt and to take care of his adopted, elderly, deaf grandfather who loves PBnJ with the crusts cut off.

When the pressure gets too much, Baby makes a run for it, along with his sweet new love, to leave the past behind.

The movie is light, a little violent, but in the end delivers justice and a great dose of sounds you want to keep hearing more and more of.

title: One of 2017's coolest movies
review: Incredible direction, action sequences, editing and music. This movie is a thrill ride from start to finish. Edgar Wright once again directs a compelling and entertaining kinetic action film with smart writing, memorable characters and a powerful story with a great soundtrack. To me it just gets better and better with each watch which really does show the power of sharp editing and incredible camera work, visual style and direction

title: Amazing
review: This movie grabs you in the start and doesn't let go,the action is amazing the music is on spot with every single gun shot,this movie is just amazing you should give it a try if you haven't already

title: Utterly unique
review:
This film is like nothing I have seen before while being utterly classical in its story and form. The film is both a heist film and (something like) a musical. The soundtrack not only drives the plot, but it is key to understanding the film and these characters. Apart from that the way in which the images are cut and structured around the music is memorizing. Wright loves to defy and blend genres; this film his zaniest in that regard.

The story-a heist gone wrong due to a young man wanting to escape crime and a love story with Oedipal overtones-is classic. It fits comfortably in with dozens of other films. But the way in which it was told is bold, striking and by a director in complete command of his craft. This is a film which style is the substance.

Baby, the character, fits in with ton of lovable rogues. He reminds me of Dean in Rebel without a Cause. The look of the character is just utterly iconic. I simply love how his disability is just treated as a given in the story. Great film.

title: 2/3 of the movie is great
review: The last of the movie is totally unrealistic and didn't fit with the beginning and middle at all. Totally waste of time.

title: Took the hype with a grain of salt
review:
And I was still disappointed. I expected a lot of the bad stuff that has been pointed out in reviews, but I was very intrigued about the use of music. Most people seemed to agree that the soundtrack, and the use of it, were great. They really weren't.

Throughout the film I felt like I was forced to listen to some self-indulgent hipster's spotify playlist. Too many songs sound so similar that it feels like the same songs playing over and over. There were lots of lesser known tracks, with the exception of a few well matured hits. That would be fine, except the tracks were poorly chosen, namely the ones for the actions scenes, which were all fast tempo, garage sounding, monotonous rock songs, that together with the sound effects made for a messy background noise for the action. They just lacked the punch and energy that this film really needed. It was more of an irritation than anything satisfying.

The editing and sound editing, although technically great, were nonetheless tiring. The gimmick of syncing gun shots and visual edits to the beat of the music gets old pretty fast. They tried to make it subtle at times, and not spam it too much, but it's there enough to actually become quite restricting in the end. Sound effects and visuals were forced right on-beat, which takes a lot of fluidity out of the action. Everything followed the music in a very rigid, lifeless manner, like someone practicing to a metronome. There's not much musical ingenuity here, with the exception of one scene where a shootout makes for a sort of a percussion interlude to "Tequila". That was good.

It could have been great, if the music was better selected to pace the action. The timing gimmick could have been used in a more musically creative way too, like gun shots creating jazzy and funky drum fills, instead of every gear shift, head shake, or door slam landing on a percussion strike.

So the couple of things this movie is mainly praised for were a let down for me. I get the sense that the music in the film is the directors personal list of all time best songs, instead of carefully selected for it. I've seen people write things like "Killer soundtrack", or "Best movie soundtrack ever". No. Come on. It's just a mixtape made by someone trying to be cool. I have these songs in spotify playlists as well. It's not an achievement.

title: Cool baked in!
review: Pretty much what the title says really, such a well executed piece of filmmaking. End of!

title: Passable but over-stylised
review: Had me watching til the end but ultimately I was disappointed. Unnecessary violence, over stylised, ropey story. Only saving grace is the romance between "Baby" and Deborah.

title: This is a great movie for a car lover and a music lover
review: This is a must see movie if you love to listen to music and drive

title: i LOVE TIHE FILM u r amazing
review: Every single has a lot of details and hidden messages you are genius

title: Entertaining, but overhyped
review: Wished I had not seen with such high expectations. Had I had less expectations I would have enjoyed it more.

title: Best Action Movie of 2017
review:
This is quite literally a legendary action film. One of the best out there. It is so damn exciting. The story of Baby is super compelling and interesting. Kevin Spacey gives his second best performance ever (after 9 lives ;)) and does a great job. Jamie Foxx, I think, gives a better performance than people give him credit for, especially in the chase scenes. And Ansel Elgort does an awesome job too. I won't even go into the cinematography, cause damn, it's good. Did I mention the action? I don't think I made it clear yet.

So yes, I love this movie. And for me, a young adolescent, it is the best movie of 2017 next to Dunkirk...............................................



and CHiPs

title: A good kick-ass film for the big-screen audience.
review:
My Rating : 8/10

This is loads of fun. It's nothing serious. Good old shoot 'em up. But made for audience in 2017.

Sleek. Cool. Showy. Bit cliche-ridden. Yes, it's all there. It entertained the hell outta me. Good for the big screen.

title: Don't believe watch yourself
review: Baby driver directed by Edgar wright is very nicely executed movie . The minute you enter the movie you feel pumped what's going to happen now . Before jaime foxx was about to die people can't understand what he was going to do . You should just watch it . It worth your time.

title: Part heist movie, part music video, all action
review:
After stealing the wrong car from the wrong man our protagonist, Baby, finds himself working as a getaway driver for that wrong man, Doc. Baby stands out from the other criminals; he doesn't say much and lives with music in his ears to drown out the tinnitus he suffers thanks to a childhood accident. Everything he does is done to music and he must have the right track for the job. The first job we see goes well but the second gets a bit messy... luckily Baby has been told this is the job that will clear his debt to Doc... unluckily it isn't long before he is told that doesn't mean he can stop driving for Doc. If he refuses it won't just be bad for him but also for those he cares for. The next job is to be a raid on a large post office... things will soon get bloody.

If found this film to be a lot of fun; early on it almost felt like a musical as we see Baby dancing through the streets as he goes to get coffee for the thieves after the first stylish car chase. We then spend some time getting to know key characters; as well as Baby and Doc these include waitress Debora, who Baby meets in a diner and crooks, Bats, Buddy and Darling. With each job the tensions increase and the body count rises. Ansel Elgort does an impressive job as Baby and Lily James is likeable as Debora. The rest of the cast features many well-known players, notably Kevin Spacey, as Doc; James Foxx, as Bats; and Jon Hamm, as Buddy. There are several really good chase scenes as well as a few impressive shootouts. There are inevitably some genre clichés as Baby falls in love, issues of trust arise and things ultimately go fairly wrong; that wasn't really a problem though. While this is primarily a stylish heist movie there are some genuinely funny moments... the scene with the wrong masks was priceless. Overall I really enjoyed this but can see that some might think it is too much style over substance.

title: Just awful
review: Haven't been as disappointed in a movie in a looooong time. Best part was opening driving segment distributed on YouTube years ago. Jon Hamm & Jamie Foxx delivered terrific performances. That's it

title: Work of art
review: Fantastic move. The cinematography and sound design are superb.

title: this movie was some ass
review:
Its like going in the house and smelling this big meal that has all kinds of dishes and everything tastes like wonder bread.

cant blame the acting,can't blame the music... but practically everything else (scripts, situations, action, suspense) was a letdown.

title: It Starts out great but becomes silly and unbelievable
review: I am going to be honest the begining sequences was good, but i start to think why is Baby's driving technique evolving from Rally car driver to the Italian Job to something out of a Tarantino flick with blood and sillyness. Sillyness like using word Rhymes and lines straight out of a Dr Seus book. I really thought this film was going to be innocent film and Baby will get away with his GF to mexico but maybe Baby has brain damage from the inital accident that killed his parents and is addicted to stay in the criminal life. Baby turns into a shoplifter and physco and the movie becomes the Terminator movie the "Good" trying to kill the bad guy, and uncessary comicial violence happens i haven't seen since a Die Hard film. The movie wanted to be commedic in parts i didn't understand the foster father bit of the movie and I guess the money that Baby was saving up was to put his foster father in a home, but he kinda was leaving it to the last minute there. I don't understand why the movie didn't just made Baby an Uber driver, a limo driver, bus coach driver you know play with driving words and thats how he makes his money or gets into misadventure, not this film where violence, uncessary blood and silly stunts happen.

title: Styled and well directed
review: Instant classic. Watched it a few times with my mates.

title: The killer track!
review: Wow! I am so blown away by how this movie turned out! I have never seen a movie that mixes both action and music together into one whole violent musical rodeo show. Baby Driver successfully tells a story where the main protagonist has so much trouble on their hands and must do whatever they can to fix the problem. After watching through the whole film, I just want to go listen to music at that point.

title: Operatic gangster musical
review:
This is all about the music, but we don't get singing actors with forced lyrics. Instead we hear the protagonists favourite songs as he plays em from a collection of mp3-players he has stolen from various cars. He is the talented get-away-driver, that fights to leave crime behind - but is forced to dance away from heists in expensive cars all day and of coz he comes with a baby face. 
This is a well written, thought out and excellent crafted movie - but you need to buy Wright's concept. Forget about real, logic and deep story plot - this is about visuals and sound or rather music!

title: Stupid
review:
The only thing worthwhile in this movie is the music. Nothing made sense, absolutely nothing.
The acting, the storyline, the characters, all a mad dash to get filmed and in the can, where it should have stayed.

title: "Baby Driver" - A Thrilling Film with Charisma and Charm
review:
Baby Driver is the perfect film for a casual moviegoer with a thirst for action, romance, and heart. It perfectly portrays the world in shades of grey, unlike the majority of blockbusters, showing only our world in black and white, good versus evil. A story of love and loss is just one of the numerous appealing parts of this film. Baby, as played by Ansel Elgort, is our lovable and heartfelt protagonist, who meets a waitress named Debora, and falls in love with her, all while experiencing a life of action and peril as a getaway driver.

Now many will tell this off as 'another action movie', which it is not. It has a deep message about the world and what we perceive as evil and bad, and about love and relationships. This film is also now famous for its incredible use of nostalgic music, like The Champs' "Tequila" and The Jon Spencer Blues Explosion's "Bellbottoms". It has well-coordinated action scenes, that have subtle timing and clever hints at the plot slipped in. This was Edgar Wright's near-perfect film, and it was as beautifully crafted as it was plain old action and car racing. Another plus is that the visual and practical effects are very impressive. I really can get immersed in Baby's world and not get seriously pulled out by anything.

Kevin Spacey's character, Doc, is a well-written tough guy with a soft spot for Baby and Debora, who really gives the movie a humorous and lighter-hearted feel. A great antagonistic performance was given by Jon Hamm, who knocks it out of the park as Buddy, as well as Jamie Foxx and Eiza González as Bats and Darling respectively. Lily James depicts Debora, Baby's love interest, and acts very well, and is as entertaining as Baby in almost every department. She really steals every scene she's in. Last, but certainly not least, is CJ Jones as Joseph, Baby's deaf foster father. He possibly gives the most convincing and great performance in the entire film. Other notables include Jon Bernthal, Flea, Lanny Loon, Sky Ferreira, Lance Palmer, and Hudson Meek.

The only major problem I have with this film is that Edgar Wright occasionally makes it painfully obvious what he wants to do. The message usually gets across very well, but the way it's presented can get a little forced. But like I said, only occasionally.

This film is a great action movie, filled with a true passion for what's being filmed, and complete with memorable performances by Ansel Elgort and others. I very much recommend this movie to anyone who wants to see a fun movie with a message to tell. 9 out of 10!

title: One of my favorite films in years
review: That was a fun ride. HIGHLY Original and with good filmography to boot, it's not only what I believe is Edgar Wrights best pieces of work, but it's just overall an absolutely incredible film. You should be watching it.

title: Fun heist movie
review: Baby Driver is a fun action movie from the perspective of the getaway driver. The movie uses its soundtrack with great effect to improve the story and for the audience to enjoy. I enjoyed all of the acts, but the movie is a slow burn. The third act is so action driven that it required the first 2 act's buildups to have a bigger effect. Although some may complain about the ending, I enjoyed it even if it felt rushed.

title: It's a 10 from me
review: Sorry guys, but it's a 10 from me, completely made my evening. Sifting through Sky movies, I settled on this. 4 hours later, I'm still buzzing and listening to the soundtrack album. But then again I also enjoyed The Last Showman!!

title: Fantastic soundtrack brimming with tracks
review: Edgar Wright has made a pleasing movie accompanied by a fantastic soundtrack brimming with tracks that will make you engrossed in the proceedings of the film. Baby driver is a fast paced, stylish film that should be watched and appreciated. (A killer soundtrack and a must watch)

title: Unexpected diamond
review:
This film really did make me feel good, it had action, a love story, great plot and an awesome soundtrack.

A clever crime caper centered around baby (Ansel Elgort), who is the good guy caught up and bad world. He falls for waitress Deborah (Lilly James) and plans to leave the world of crime behind but Doc (spacey), doesn't want to lose his number 1 driver and good luck charm.

Don't be fooled by the trailers, this film is a love story so don't be caught unawares, but it's a very good love story. Special mention to Jamie Foxx and John Hamm who were both fantastic, but in truth, the whole cast were awesome.

I went to the cinema to watch it and I've watched it at home since and I still enjoy it as much as the first time.

title: All you need is one killer track...
review:
Baby Driver, follows misunderstood Baby who is a getaway driver for those who live for the life of crime. Baby Driver is one heck of a movie with awesome car chases, crazy characters, a great love story, and one great music playlist. The movie is great for times when you just want to watch something. The movie does have lessons and meanings though most of the movie is just for fun and just to tell a story. The ending is shocking and the film is just a ride of epic proportions. I would highly recommend the movie for those looking for a good action film and for anybody looking for good music. Also, props to Ansel Elgort who must have had a tough time getting into Baby's character and hands down the cast was great! It is appropriate for most teens depending on the kid, just has a lot of violence and language. Highly recommend!

"Sometimes all I want is to head West on 20 in a car I can't afford, with a plan I don't have, just me, my music, and the road."- Deborah, Baby Driver

title: Always intresting, Good story
review:
Good action movie!
Good script, you never loose intrest.

title: Fine work of editing
review:
Honestly, editing on this was superb. One of the best I've seen. And that's what made it interesting to keep on going. The style is what brought it out. Substance honestly didn't matter in this movie, since it's meant to have a central "musical car race" theme to it. It may be getting a bunch of terrible weight under it for it's non-substance just like I said. Average story, average crime stuff. But the editing and music. That's the thing this tried to reach as the "emotion."

Making a great story isn't supposed to be integrated into every single movie. This brought theme and ultimate driving. The driving scenes were perfect, accompanied with the music to show the perspective of how the main protagonist deals with his criminal world. And when he rejects it, more hardcore and tough situations and music lights up to show more struggle. So in technical cinematic terms, this is basically a masterpiece. Acting was great. And the ending wasn't really good, but it's still worth a watch from the legendary Edgar Wright.

title: Feel good crime caper
review: Very well made, well acted. Enjoyed it tremendously because it was different and reasonably original.

title: Great heist movie, good ending
review: I wasn't sure I would like this movie, but I was pleasantly surprised. The story is good, I liked all the actors and the soundtrack is amazing. The ending was excellent, so happy that Baby did his time rather than the usual which would be either gunned down by police or on the run for the rest of his life. The one thing that I notice being done alot in movies, is when innocent people stand around watching instead of running from certain evil. Towards the end of the movie Doc, Baby & Debora are all standing in the garage, when Doc tells Baby & Debora to run as Buddy charges towards them in a stolen police car. But instead of running, Baby & Debora both just stand there watching while Doc is mowed down by Buddy. Even after Doc tells them a second time to "run!" they stand and watch. I suppose it makes for a more suspenseful movie if our hero is almost killed instead of simply running to safety? Overall an excellent movie which I've watched several times.

title: Stylish
review:
"Baby" is a getaway driver for teams put together by crime boss Doc. He plays music on his iPod constantly in order to drown out the tinnitus which resulted from the car accident in which his parents died. He lives with his elderly, infirm, deaf foster father, and is only doing the driving until he has paid off a debt to Doc. Certain members of the crime crews have extremely negative reactions to his constant wearing headphones. When Baby falls for waitress Debora and vice versa, he decides he wants to get out of the game and run away with her. But Doc has other ideas, and hostile Bats is a complete wild card.

In some respects, Baby Driver is a completely routine crime thriller, but Edgar Wright as writer and director brings a sense of style to it which we don't see very often. Given Wright's involvement with the Simon Pegg Cornetto trilogy movies, one might expect comedy here. Well, it's not nihilistically dark, but neither is it packed with laughs. But it is always involving.

Baby speaks little and is ostensibly rather bland, and Ansel Elgort portrays this well. Towards the start there is an extended moving camera shot as Baby takes coffee to a planning meeting, and the movement and sound editing tell you as much about Baby's character as you need to know thus far. There is a LOT of music in this movie, and all of it well chosen. Lily James as Debora is gorgeous - I wanted to run away with her too. Kevin Spacey plays Doc as an odd mixture of mincing and paternal: it works, but it's odd. And Jamie Foxx as Bats is vile. I was very please when what happened to him happened to him.

The developments towards the end aren't always what you expect, and the ending certainly isn't. But It's fair, and I liked it, and all the loose ends are nicely tied up.

I enjoyed this, and it promises great things in the future from Edgar Wright.

title: Brilliant!!
review:
I was excited to see this movie, and had my expectations pretty high to be honest. But oh man, my expectations were toped, and not just a litte bit... The reviews to this Edgar Wright film are all pretty good I'd say, but I didn't find this movie just good, it was excellent! I just loved nearly all of it, and especially the soundtrack was wonderful. The action, driving, shootout - scenes were just brilliant, and the best thing was probably the music as mentioned before. It just made it much faster and more enjoyable to watch because good music just makes it better. All in all, the best movie in 2017 for me, go and watch it if you haven't, you won't regret it.

10 out of 10!

title: A different beast from the director's other work, this is an entertaining flick with a V6-engine for a brain and an MP3 player for a heart.
review: To say this is perhaps Edgar Wright's weakest film is like comparing a ruby to three diamonds and one slightly shinier ruby - at the end of the day it's still a gem, just a slightly less precious one. It's hard to know exactly how I feel about 'Baby Driver (2017)' in relation the the director's other work, as it's a different beast altogether, and I feel comparisons are unfair, though inevitable, so all I'll say is this: the feature is fantastic fun from beginning to end, feeling like it comes from the mind of a man who's totally in control. For me, it doesn't reach the heights of the 'Cornetto trilogy', if a side-by-side is important here, but it sits comfortably alongside 'Scott Pilgrim vs. The World (2010)' as an example of Wright's creativity coming across in a genre, and studio system, aching for some new perspective. Even though some of the meticulous musical timings (the biggest marketing draw of the piece) do seem to subside somewhat in the second act, this is a consistently enjoyable ride that uses appropriately eclectic music and fantastically sly performances to keep you smiling all the way through. Its sonic syncing is more noticeable on a second watch and isn't as brash as the marketing would lead you to believe, though nor is it as important. The piece isn't a comedy, either, which may have thrown some people off. It is still a generally light thriller with plenty of witty writing and some funny moments, though. The action really is fantastic, in a generally less violent and more free-flowing kind of way, with its focus placed far more on the balletic elements of such sequences than the aggressive ones. There are still proper stakes, though, thanks to the piece's well-written script that constantly keeps you caring. 8/10

title: Nice one
review:
I consider it as a perfect movie, there is nothing missed, performance, music, action, fun, and more
So the time in this movie don't consider as a wasted time

title: One of my favorite films of 2017
review: One of the best films from 2017, Ansel Elgort portrays the odd but attractive behaviors of Baby very well. The story line was definitely great but the best part in my opinion was the spot on soundtrack.

title: Best action of 1017

title: It is the perfect action movie!!!
review: I love everything about this movie. I was already like Ansel, and his acting along with his dance moves was fun. I liked him with Lily James, their scenes were cute. The musics were in sync with every scene and it gets me pumped up. It was a fun way to spend 2 hours

title: How did I miss this?
review: It's brilliant; pace, acting, directing, the visuals are stunning and so well executed, the sound track is brilliant fun and we were playing id the song when the intro's started, perfect, I should have given it a 10 really (and Joe was so cool)
