title: May not be a traditional masterpiece but is right up there.
review:
The first thing people are going to mention about this thoroughly entertaining Edgar Wright film is the soundtrack. While this is not in itself a bad thing, because the soundtrack is indeed amazing and plays a large part in both the style and the story, it is not the only thing that is great.

Ansel Elgort and Kevin Spacey give stand out performances against a backdrop of an all-star cast including Jamie Foxx, Lilly James and Jon Hamm, all of whom play their parts with an ease that makes them a pleasure to watch.

The other stars of this film are the often unmentioned stunt teams. The car chases especially feel fresh, new and exciting and when you throw the music that I mentioned earlier into the mix you will feel a real part of it. More than just cool moves to pumping tracks though, the action is actually choreographed to the music and the effect is amazing. Every gunshot, tire screech, car horn and movement works with the beat to give you an exciting scene experience that leaves you breathless and wanting more.

Telling the story of a young man named Baby, who is a professional getaway driver (who needs music in order to complete his jobs), as he navigates through the criminal underworld he is caught up in. you may immediately start to make comparisons with the 2011 film "Drive" but let me stop you straight away, this is a very different film playing a lot less serious and dark. That is not to say that "Baby Driver" does not have its own dark moments but you are going to leave the theatre in a much better mood than you likely did with "Drive"!

The film is not without its flaws of course, you could say the base story seems a little cliché in places and some of the characters are a tad underdeveloped so their motives do not always seem clear and their actions seem to be purely there to move the story to the next scene. To be honest though, these minor issues fade away as soon as you notice them as frankly, you just don't care because the flow of the movie is just so good.

"Baby Driver" may not be a masterpiece in the traditional sense, but for me, and I am sure anyone that appreciates a film that is not just immensely enjoyable, but a film that has clearly had a lot of care and attention put into it. It is right up there.

title: Deja Vu
review:
Imagine it is 1987, and you are a budding teenage screenwriter/director. You wake up in the middle of the night with a great idea for a script about a young man with a Sony Walkman and hearing problem who can drive a car like Ryan O'Neal in The Driver. Your guy is younger and more innocent, and you picture Brad Pitt, who you have been watching on TV's Dallas, as your star.

Along side Brad, you see Jennifer Jason Leigh, after seeing her in The Hitcher and Sister, Sister. She is the young heroine, a waitress. For the sinister mastermind, you envision Gene Hackman. And for the heavy, ruthless hard-ass, you picture Samuel L. Jackson, fresh from Spenser: For Hire. Throw in Mel Gibson as another heavy and a cocky ingenue Marisa Tomei (from the World Turns) as his moll. Finally, you add a soundtrack with work from Paul Simon, James Brown, Dave Brubeck, The Commodores, Isaac Hayes, Barry White, Queen, The Beach Boys, Randy Newman, Quincy Jones, Ike and Tina Turner, The Allman Brothers Band, Aretha Franklin, Phil Collins, Kiss, and a whole bunch of newbies.

You call it "Baby Driver" and hitchhike to the studios in Hollywood, who are impressed by your juvenile spunk and love the idea but cannot see the casting. "Brad what?" "Gene is doing another Superman." "Samuel L. who?" "Marisa Tommy?!?!?" "You will never get Mel in a supporting role." "What is all that music 'mixing' about?" "Go home and grow up!" You are discouraged and set your script on your shelf. However, you never give up.

Thirty years later, you dust it off and get Ansel to do Brad's role and Lily to do Jennifer's. Instead of Gene, you get Kevin Spacey. For Mr. Jackson's role, you recruit Jamie Foxx. Finally, you pull in John Hamm and Elza Gonzalez to fit Mel Gibson and Marisa Tomei's roles.

You keep your soundtrack intact, including the newbies who are no longer new, and add newer newbies, too.

Done.

title: Overrated and the main character is not suited for the actor
review:
4 things i absolutely hated.

1st: this actor doesn't belong in these movies he has a face of a child. Maybe With a beard he'll look different.

2nd: min44. when doc didn't keep his word and threatened baby into another job, Baby could've countered Him by saying i'm your lucky charm card you will never do such thing to me. or something like that. I would've liked it at least.

3rd: near the ending. he got deaf by getting shot closer to his ears.

4th: the ending. he surrendered and got 5 years in jail. The movie could've ended in him just running away from the law (like fast & Furous endings) with his girlfriend and the bag of money. living in a foreign country.

title: Well, people hates on everything nowadays, aren't they?
review:
Okay, I'm didn't write review for a movie, for a long time, but this movie got me, it's literally blows me.. and like usual after i watch very good movie, i check it's page on IMDb, and shock! This movie had so many bad reviews from people (thanks God they are not from real movie critics, because Metacritic gives this movie solid 8) so.. i write this review for counter that haters out there..

1. Plot, this movie start with so brilliant way, i love how they introduce Ansel as Baby here, so fit for his character, and the second half of the movie too, maybe a little plot hole here and there and this second half that's why i gives it 9.. but i promise you that still many twist you would enjoy.

2. Music, this is one of biggest part of movie, and i watch it because of this too, if you can, please watch this movie with your favorite headphones, thanks God i watch it on my PS4 and the music literally made me shake my head and hand even though so many new song for me from this. I love when they sometimes make a music to literally tell one or two mood in the scene.

3. Just watch it, and every good rating out there on rotten and metacritic is not wrong..

title: No actual plot
review:
The entire movie you will be lost as to why the main character is doing this stuff for an old man who just using him for his skills, second of all why would they not just focus on one story-line instead of jumping from one plot to the next, the end is so vague with the old man suddenly cares about the main character to defend him LOL, total carp, would not recommend to anyone.

Absolute bore, will feel like taking breaks in between to just let it end. If you like this movie good for you.

title: Pretty great movie.
review:
Spider Man: Homecoming, The Hit-man's Bodyguard, Dunkirk, The Dark Tower, and Baby Driver are a few of the films that came out over the summer. After watching all of these and more, I believe that the movie Baby Driver will give you the best experience. In the movie, we are introduced to Baby, a driver of sorts for Doc, who organizes robberies and crimes for a "crew." Edgar Wright (the director) utilizes a fast-paced, energized plot that develops characters at the same time, amazing cinematography/camera work, and a soundtrack synchronized with action in order to create a refreshing film that will leave any viewer desperate for more.

If you skip to any point in Baby Driver, you are guaranteed to be met with one of the following: a high speed car chase, an electrifying shootout, or tense and guarded dialogue between colleagues who do not, and should not trust each other. Wright uses these three things to create an action-packed plot that will keep you on the edge of your seat. At the same time however, he uses minute details in order to show the differences between Baby and the criminals he works with, such as Bats (Jamie Foxx), Buddy (Jon Hamm), Darling (Eiza González), and Griff (Jon Bernthal). Bats and the rest of the criminals are all rough men and women who are willing to do anything to finish a job, and make a few bucks. Baby, on the other hand, takes care of his adoptive, deaf father, prevents the murders of a few innocent people, and even throws a woman her purse after he steals her car. Wright does not forsake his characters in order to abuse the adrenaline rush viewers get from action. This adds an undertone that satisfies those who seek a film that solely focuses on character relationships. As a result of the well rounded approach Wright takes to make Baby Driver, he creates a movie that a wide range of people can enjoy.

In terms of camera usage/editing, Baby Driver excels. Colors seem to pop out from the screen, and Wright even designed each character's clothing according to their personality, with criminals wearing brighter colors, and Baby wearing duller clothing. This creates a clashing of sorts, which further exemplifies the difference between Baby and the true criminals. On top of this, car chases in the movie are extremely fluid and continuous, while also making a viewer appreciate the sharp turns/complex maneuvers Baby is utilizing while driving. During gunfights, crazy stunts are used, but do not muddle the scene itself, preventing the viewer from being completely confused. As a result, visuals are crisp and connected, while also being informative at the same time.

Where the film really excels, though, is in the form of its soundtrack. The soundtrack melds together with its visuals to create an extremely captivating experience. As you watch the film, you begin to realize that nearly every action sequence is timed along with the soundtrack. Music is such a huge part of the movie because of Baby's medical condition, tinnitus. In the opening scene, Baby is listening to "Bellbottoms." He dances and taps his fingers inside his car, and even his windshield wipers move in time with the song. During the meetings where the criminals plan their heists, Baby is constantly listening to music, and tapping his fingers along to the beat. During the scenes with a large amount of action, gunshots are also perfectly timed with the backing songs. People getting hit by cars, dialogue, and explosions are seemingly choreographed to fall in line perfectly along with whatever is playing at the time. Car chases follow the same pattern, and the film overall gives almost a music video vibe (a very good music video).

Baby Driver is an amazing, and innovative film. It superbly combines visuals and audio, and has plenty of car chases/gunfights to satisfy any avid action-addict. At the same time however, it will also satisfy those who look for character growth. The film as a whole gives a welcome change of direction, one particularly focused on giving viewers a perfect blend of what you see and hear. It is a very impressive film, and a must watch.

title: Absolutely Outstanding and Entertaining Film! 2017's Best!
review:
Easily one of the best films I have seen. Remains entertaining from start to finish. The tension is palpable, the characters are memorable, and the plot flows smoothly from start to finish.

I could re-watch this movie a dozen times and enjoy it every single time. The music is seamlessly integrated into the story and adds some wonderful tempo to the film. This is an example of a music team that knows their timing well.

Overall, I HIGHLY recommend seeing this film and ignore all of the 1-star trolls. They can't seem to branch out beyond Steven Seagal movies anyways.

See this film!

Edgar Wright has done it again!

title: The best movie I have ever seen
review: Baby Driver is an incredible movie. It's well acted, written, incredibly well directed, and the editing is award worthy. Even if you don't like this movie, there is no reason to give it a 1/10. What aspects of it make it the worst movie ever? The technical aspects are awesome, as is everything else. Don't listen to the negative crowd who rags on genuinely good movies just to rag on them.

title: Don't listen to bad reviews!
review: To me this movie was refreshing. The style of storytelling was different and although I agree the story was a bit cliché, but at the end I enjoyed every part of the movie. The main reason for the difference is that music plays a major part in this movie, it is brilliantly edited in the scenes and captures the mood perfectly. If you enjoy listening to your headphones while doing stuff, I think you'll get a kick out of this one like me ;) In the end, I see some people giving the movie 1 star reviews simply because in their minds it doesn't deserve the current rating. I would like to tell them respect other people opinions and grow up!

title: A 16 year old's dream
review:
If you're struggling to find a movie to watch with your teenage kids, this could be the one to hold their attention long enough...and yours.. If you try hard enough.

The car chases and soundtrack almost make up for a rather lame story line and the lack of character development.

The ending is a bit of a sneeze in the wind and its not going to keep you up at night but considering how to the rest of the movie unfolded, I couldn't have expected anything more.

title: Cool, original, on point...And I found it absolutely brilliant
review: Hands down, Baby Driver is one of the best movies I've seen in cinemas and I absolutely loved it. The trailer was pretty cool, so I told myself that I should go check out the movie and when I saw it, I just couldn't believe they finally did a movie like this one...Congrats Edgar Wright. The action keeps you on edge, the acting is on point and hell..The music is just f***ing amazing.It's the kind of movie that makes you wanna say "f**ck yeah" every 10 minutes. There were some things that were kinda odd, but I give this one a 10/10 because so did Rotten Tomato and I just wanted to flip off all the haters.

title: Nobody Puts Baby in the Corner Especially if he is your Getaway Driver
review:
Funny story actually, I was watching this movie via livestream and while I waited for it to buffer, I watched another movie on TV. 'Ferris Bueller's Day Off' with Jennifer Grey, you know baby from 'Dirty Dancing'. Both 'Ferris Bueller's Day Off' and 'Dirty Dancing' were far superior movies than this. However this movie is one big funny goofball. Please don't take it seriously as it feels like a satire of the genre. In a way it is watered down 'Drive' meets 'NFS the movie'. The faults in this movie is what makes it great.

Now for the faults the guys here have got it spot on: https://youtu.be/7bODxbLAvDo

title: Short Summery
review:
The movie isn't overrated at all.

The movie is great...the acting is top notch with some small hick ups ...Its not the usual boring action movie we get every year, its something different and it works,ignore all the comments about the soundtrack being for teens...its mostly retro hits from the 80s. The end was kinda bland for my taste but I overall enjoyed this film and I would recommend it to any film lover.

The way the movie was shot was magnificent , the camera movement itself made it worth watching.

If you're a casual movie goer this movie might be a bit strange but if you study or love the art of filmography...you will enjoy this movie more than most.

the score is well deserved.

title: He is just a Baby boy... Don't expect more :)
review: After seeing the trailer I have to say I had I hopes and I was eagerly waiting for the movie. But after watching it I felt something is missing. Baby Driver hits you really fast with the entertainment and makes you connect with the main character (Baby) really quickly. However, there are a lot of characters in the movie that are overdeveloped, underdeveloped, or just otherwise unnecessary. I don't understand the character contribute of Eiza Gonzalez's. Also Jamie Foxx's character was just got WAY too much screen time. Other than that, the action sequences are so incredibly good that you feel a bit bored during many of the dialogues. Also, there is a certain scene that kind of contradicts one of Spacey's superstitions that felt a bit contrived, stemming from an entire 10 minute aside that the movie could've just done without in my opinion. And finally the END part. Baby faces his karma and go to jail. That also made the end very sweet and obvious Bollywood style. I will recommend this movie for its entertainment value, but if you have an eye for quality, except average and your expectations will be met.

title: B-A-B-Y, Baby
review: Let's be honest, there are not many films made these days that you can say, " I can't wait to watch that again!". Then comes Baby Driver, a cool, clever, well written, beautifully acted piece of visual pleasure. Edgar Wright has used the skills of indie film making and produced something truly amazing. From the opening scene with driving that would make Vin Diesel's stunt man stop and stare, to the one continuous shot of baby going to buy coffee, absolutely incredible. Accompanied by the best soundtrack since Pulp Fiction and Jackie Brown, Baby Driver is one of those movies that will never go out of style, and for me has joined the small list of classic movies that will always be welcomed viewing on my television screen.

title: An Instant Cult Classic
review:
The summer blockbuster season is upon us which means it's the perfect time for studios to release loud, overproduced, underdeveloped action films to the waiting masses. Sitting in the theater as Baby Driver was screened I could hear the bass thump of Transformers in the theater next door, sounding as if World War III had broken out as a natural disaster took place. And I couldn't help but think if it's that annoying on our side of the dividing wall, how annoying is it inside? And then I stuffed that thought because I was watching Baby Driver and enjoying the hell out of myself.

Baby Driver is Edgar Wright's (director of Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, and Scott Pilgrim vs. The World) latest film starring Ansel Elgort, Jon Hamm, Kevin Spacey, and Jamie Foxx. In it we follow a twenty-something year old getaway driver named Baby as he tackles his final jobs and begins to adjust to a normal life only to be pulled back.

I call Baby Driver a gem in a sea of turds and opened with a complaint about summer blockbusters because Baby Driver may be overlooked by the general movie-going crowd in lieu of Transformers or the upcoming Spider-Man film. It's had a relatively modest ad campaign, word-of-mouth discussion of the trailer and advanced screenings has garnered interest. But aside from perhaps being overlooked, it's also an action movie that isn't loud or full of CG, it has a competent script and involves you in a way that the vast majority of action films do not.

Case in point: The very opening scene. The scene tells us everything about the style of Baby Driver. First of all: the music. Baby Driver could arguably be considered a musical. Nearly every scene has background music and most of the action whether it is gun play, driving, or just mundane tasks matches the music. The sound of money being stacked on a table coincides with the beats of the song being played. Gunshots do the same in another sequence. It's a level of technical prowess that is jaw-dropping and left a smile on my face throughout.

Secondly: the action. The opening sequence bank getaway had me at the edge of my seat with adrenaline pumping. I haven't sat in a theater and felt that way since The Raid 2 three years ago. The direction is wonderful, the cuts are perfect, and the stunt work is stupendous. Add to that a good amount of humor and some intelligent situations and solutions and you have a short but sweet sequence that would make a James Bond film jealous.

The movie continues to have fantastic practical stunt work throughout, though after the initial robbery, things slow down. There is another robbery but otherwise you spend about sixty minutes watching Baby's life normalize. He meets a girl at a diner and they hook up, he lives with a mute elderly man and you see their relationship strengthen, he begins work as a pizza delivery guy. It's a very typical character arc and you know from the moment we get into the mundane that it's a precursor to things hitting the fan.

The unevenness of the middle portion might turn off some viewers. There's humor and good music but the promise of gripping car chase sequences is dashed by a human element that is somewhat unexpected given the over-the-top nature of the first twenty or thirty minutes. The romance is compelling if only because Baby is a tragic man who you can identify with and want to see escape the criminal life.

Once Baby is pulled back into criminality and the big job is planned, the film goes back to being fast-paced and action packed. The adrenaline is there, but so is a very dark dread and suspense. A lot of pretty obvious things happen that intermingle Baby's attempt at normal life with his criminal life and though a trope seen multiple times before, Edgar Wright manages to make it fresh and leave us at the edge of our seats. Will Baby escape this life? I won't spoil what happens but it's a hell of a ride through those final thirty minutes. Just when you think its over, it keeps going, ratcheting up the tension. It's immaculate execution.

And as the credits rolled and I stood up, a smile on my face, I watched the old people file out of the theater, frowning or talking about how bad the film was. I guess they expected Baby Driver to be like Baby's Day Out or something.

This Fourth of July weekend, go see Baby Driver. It's one of the tightest films I've seen in recent years with a great script, amazing action, a kick-ass soundtrack, interesting characters, and a director at the helm who knows how to make a beautiful and powerful piece of cinema. A definite action masterpiece and I'm sure an instant cult classic.

title: Very good movie
review: Its an amazing movie , One of the best Id seen this year was a lot of everything love , blood, comedy, music, action (exaggerated but good) and how the music is involved with the movie was the best. Ansel do a such a nice actuation and the movie have very good actors . The drama is similar to a couple titles but how they do the movie gives a unique style . I love that is very in-usual is not like the same cause you don't know have its gonna do next gives you a lot of adrenaline!

title: Best movie of the year
review:
I haven't felt this good coming out of a movie screening in a long time.

This movie spells F-U-N.

Fun characters, sure most of them are cliché, and it is deliberate! Just look at their nicknames: Doc (the mastermind), Buddy (the friendly muscle), Darling (the bubblegum-popping fierce gal), Baby (literally babyface kid), and Bats (the crazy one).This is played so perfectly to a point.

Fun chase scenes. Familiar? Maybe, we've seen enough Furious movies. Smart? Most of the time. Fun? Absolutely.

Fun romance. Ain't nothing more fun than an innocent teenage first date with a flirtatious (on both sides) counterpart in a laundromat. And they didn't even have to cheapen it with a sex scene. What a breath of fresh air there. Fun heist plot. It's almost like a different version of Ocean's eleven.

Fun banter. A lot of pop cultural references. That Mike Myers joke is gold.

Fun choreography. If you liked the opening sequence, it is followed by a fun MTV style of a character lip syncing and dancing timed perfectly to the lyrics of song - playing in Baby's headphones - literally written on the walls.

Fun style. I am a sucker for 50s stuff - classic diner, classic mix tapes (well.. more 80s in that sense), classic cars, and a long drive to the west.

Fun music. All I want to do now is to download the whole OST album. They stretched the final showdown a little bit but they nailed the ending. I leave the room a satisfied customer.

Don't know if this is an actual easter egg: The disguise outfit that Baby took from the shop, ie. blue baseball cap and denim jacket, is the same outfit that Ryan Gosling's driver (in "Drive") wears when escaping police pursuit.

title: Slightly disappointing
review:
This film has plenty of scenes that put a smile on your face. The combination of an ultra-cool baby-faced hero, a killer soundtrack and a tongue-in-cheek heist theme should be the ultimate recipe for a film with maximum entertainment value. Especially when the director is not afraid to make creative use of those ingredients. The scene of lead character Baby walking down the street to the music of Bob and Earl's Harlem Shuffle, and using everything he sees as an imaginary musical instrument, is great cinema. There are many such moments in this film, which is driven (pun intended) by its soundtrack of 35 songs that are almost without exception great music.

Still, I left the cinema slightly disappointed. Towards the end, this cool, stylish and original film morphs into an unimaginative succession of shootouts and car chases, not so much different from any commercial Hollywood blockbuster. By then, the multitude of screeching tires, machine guns and crashing police vehicles has become a bit tiresome. The contrast between the super exciting first five minutes of the film and the dull and boring last fifteen, couldn't have been bigger.

title: No greatness, but a fun watch with cult potential
review:
"Baby Driver" is a British/American co-production from this year that made pretty big waves recently. Only part of it is justified I guess. But first things first: The writer and director of this 110-minute movie is Edgar Wright and he is mostly known so far for his collaborations with Simon Pegg. But for this new movie, he is the man in charge alone. Oh yeah and Scott Pilgrim he made too and you can maybe see a parallel here and there in terms of the style, even if the subject and genres are entirely different here for sure. You get a mix of music and crime in this new one with an ounce of romance, lots of action and thriller elements. Don't be fooled by the title here, this was a pretty tense and entertaining work from start to finish. I think it has all the ingredients to become as much of a success as Scott Pilgrim, probably even a better lead actor. I won't go into detail a lot about the story, lets just give a really basic summary. This is the story of a young man who is a highly gifted driver, a prodigy really and we find out what happens when he tries to make his criminal endeavors a thing of the past.

His boss is played by 2-time Oscar winner winner Kevin Spacey, one of his partners in crime is played by Oscar winner Jamie Foxx (nice Oscar quote by him too) and the third big name is Jon Hamm, the star from Mad Men, one of the finest shows in television history and with his turn here he absolutely made the successful transition from small screen star to big screen star if he hadn't before already. No doubt we will see him in many more theatrical releases in the next years/decades. If lead actor Elgort is not bringing it for you, or the stunning Lily James who plays his love interest and light at the end of the tunnel, then one of the aforementioned trio should for sure I hope. I personally found it an interesting idea to have Hamm be the main antagonist eventually and the earlier statement by Eiza González' character was a good indicator of the ending. You sure would expect Spacey's character to be the main antagonist, or Foxx' as Hamm even lets the Driver get away before Foxx shows up before the escalation at the end. Anyway, Hamm did an amazing job and was maybe the best thing about the entire film (besides James' looks). But here we also get to one of the film's weaknesses. Spacey's character's transformation into loyal helper really went against everything we learned about him earlier. Another issue was the protagonist turning into a real survivalist with everything that happens to him as the film's core is that he is really just the driver, not the fighter who even gets his hands dirty. It did not feel too realistic that apparently he has more very refined skills in other fields.

But I still believe that the positive and entertaining here was way more frequent than the negative. For example a scene at the very beginning stayed in my mind when we don't see the action in the bank, but the action in the car as it is all about Baby, the entire film. And the songs used in here were good choices for sure. I liked listening to them, even if I did not know them, as they fit the particular situation nicely. I kept wondering if there will be a sequel, but with everything that happened in the last half hour and also the major flash forward at the very end, it seems almost impossible, especially given the fact Wright is not known at all for sequels to his big successes. This one here is quickly turning into one of these. It is certainly not as great as IMDb voters, who include it in the best 250 films ever made, or critics want us to believe at this point, but it felt like a pretty nicely handled slightly under 2 hours that will probably never be considered mediocre or weak filmmaking. And rightfully so. I enjoyed this movie for a whole bunch of reasons and I am sure that for example the F&F franchise can learn a whole lot from this one on how to combine car action and convincing story-telling. "Baby Driver" gets a thumbs-up from me and it is among the best fun films of 2017 so far, most likely gonna stay there until the end of the year.

title: Radar Love
review:
Baby (Ansel Elgort) is a professional get-away driver working for Kevin Spacey whose job is to think of plans to rob Atlanta. Baby cares for a deaf-mute foster father and is crushing on the local waitress who reminds him of his mother.

It doesn't sound like much, but what makes the film is the over-the-top driving scenes done to music. I can't believe they didn't play "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" or "Hot Rod Lincoln" but that is just me. Simple film, Good characters. And of course, a love story.

Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.

title: Great, except....
review: The cinematography is unbelievable. The editing is perfect. The script is ingenious. The acting, especially by Jamie Foxx, is top-notch. The action is pulse-pounding. The sound editing is superb and the soundtrack sublime. It's almost enough to make me forget that the last half-hour of this film makes absolutely no freaking logical sense whatsoever. Almost.

title: Edgar Wright proves again, he is one of the best directors out there
review: What to say, besides that this is a freaking great movie. The story is interesting and the movie is intense from start to finish. The characters are great and funny and the way thinks folds out in the end is great. What i love about this movie to, is that the Music match the scenes and action sequences perfectly. Overall a great movie and highly recommended.

title: One word describes Edgar Wrights latest work...Genius
review: The amount of effort put into this film is noticeable and with terrific outcomes. Young star Ansel Elgort proves he is not just a child actor looking to go pro, he delivers! Kevin Spacey is also solid, as usual. The real treat of this film is the beautiful aesthetics that bring everything together, from hints on background TV's to GRAFFITTI that helps you sing-a-long. My personal favorite aspect of this masterful 112 minutes is Jon Hamm who delivers the performance of his life. Hamm achieves this through polarizing his character and ebbing out of his comfort zone. Baby Driver = 9/10

title: Film of 2017
review:
Edgar Wright displays with this film why he is one of the most creative filmmakers working in the industry today.

This film has a little of everything and is entertaining throughout. The creativity and the technical industry displayed in this film is astounding and should be celebrated.

I urge everyone to see it on the biggest screen with the loudest sound system possible.

title: This movie is entertaining & fun
review:
So do yourself a favor and do not listen to the negative comments here. I mean seriously. This movie has fun and entertaining story and I believe that's enough for a weekend night. I didn't see the review first and I watch it straight away. And now I know I did the right thing!

You don't want to get a life lesson from every single movie you are watching, but in case if you need, go and read a book. Don't waste your time with movies at all.

title: One of the best movies of 2017, and now, one of my top 10 films of all time.
review:
This seemingly mild manner name of a movie is anything but. This is an adrenaline heart pumping race car action stylized cinematic thriller in scene after scene with precision focus taking you on an experience unlike any other movie of its kind.

The direction and cinematography balanced with a well-developed story line blows everything else out of the water that I've seen in a long time. You are taking on a ride that you have never experienced before in theatrical avenues, twisting and turning not only around every corner but your stomach is going along for the ride as well.

The backstory of the protagonist offers a sympathetic gesture of sincere emotional effect that will have you caring deeply for this once child with a heartbreaking past, now a young adult caught in a web of crime with no less than the great Kevin Spacey taking on the role of the father figure, of which possesses a cool Mafia-like demeanor underscoring just how threatening not only his presence is, but the emotions that he evokes that would put a scare into just about anyone.

This was a joy ride of epic proportions and one that I will be watching over and over again because it pulled at almost every emotional heart string within me, and even hours after watching it, the emotional ride is still with me and will be for a long time to come.

title: Nothing is better compared to this
review: I really cant say my feelings for this movie. It just really awesome and so amuse me. This action movie packed with comedy but its not just like that. It brings the new experience with the music style that suit for every scene ! It is so cool and i can say this is the coolest movie i have ever seen in my life ! That camera angle too is so good and i can say this is the true art of movies. Do you want to watch something new and makes you fascinated ? This is the one !

title: The best action movie in years!
review:
'Baby Driver' is a perfect example of how good an action movie can be if it's original, hilarious, exciting and well done. I waited months to see it as it was the first time I saw Ansel Elgort in an action flick.

And also because in general, the whole cast not only looked awesome at trailer and the poster, but everyone actually did a great job at the movie: Ansel was just perfect and irresistibly funny at his leading role; I freaking fell in love with the character of Lily James, and with how perfect Ansel and her looked together; Mr. Spacey was excellent too; Mr Foxx and Mr. Hamm were simply hateful, which was a good thing. And it was good to me to see Eiza González in a more serious role than in all the things she did before.

And the music, oh my God the music was just excellent. Every song was very well selected and perfectly fit in every single minute of the movie. It gave to it the whole atmosphere it had to have. This will probably make you doubt about the time context of the story, which you will totally enjoy.

10/10. As an action movie is simply perfect and exciting, I totally recommend it to you. I already saw it three times at the cinema, and believe me, even if you don't like action movies, this one is going to impress you. In a few years it will be probably considered an action classic.

Thanks for reading!

P.S. And teens, I'm very happy to say that you can perfectly see this one with your parents as it doesn't have very much graphic violence, and it has no coarse language in a sexual context or any sexual scenes. And it is also an excellent choice to see with your girlfriend.

title: A Refreshing Movie
review:
it's a Good Movie

i really enjoy the whole movie, the concept, the music, the cast, except one thing.

It feels a little bit weird seeing someone drives that good but didn't really into cars, he didn't even really care about the car he drives nor preparing his car for every of the "mission" . but yes he just a car driver not a car enthusiast.

after all, i hope there would be a sequel !

title: Best film of 2017
review:
This film has everything and more. I loved it so much and wish more films could pull off what this film did.

It has great music and musical moments. Good editing. Some funny moments. Romance. Awesome actors and good acting all round. and lastly fun action scenes. What more could you want!?

Don't miss out :)

title: Amazing
review:
Baby(Elgort) is a young getaway driver who works for Doc(Spacey). Baby is an amazing driver and a lucky charm for Doc's robberies. Baby remains as a constant of all Doc's robberies. When Baby was almost done being involved in robberies and starts to settle with Debora(James), Doc brings him back by threatening him. Doc then plans a robbery bringing a new teams to do this but,all the individuals are incompatible with each other.

As usual, Edgar successfully utilized all his trademarks in this movie but concentrated more on the action sequences and a stronger script.

Elgort, Spacey were great in this movie. Some of the side characters were intersting like Griff, Darling and Bats. The music was amazing and was perfect for the respective sequences. The stunts were excellent and cinematography was really good. The movie did utilize it's R rating well.

Overall,Baby Driver was a highly entertaining movie and is recommended for all who loves action and movies which utilizes alot of car stunts. Also, it's one of Edgar's finest.

title: B-A-B-Y. baby
review:
Baby Driver is an action movie directed by Edgar Wright and stars Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey, Lily James, Jon Hamm, Jamie Foxx and Eiza Gonzalez.

Personally i am a fan of Edgar Wright and has expectation from this movie too and i was not disappointed after watching this movie. The movie has it's own charm as in this movie rhythm of music doesn't matched with footsteps but matches with the screeching of tyres and sound of bullets whenever they plan a heist.

Acting by Elgort was superb and the main attraction of the movie. There were lots of expectation from Spacey but he stays in his own territory. Foxx and Hamm were a treat to watch with Hamm surely leads between the two. Two Female casts were equally good.

Screenplay of the movie is gripping and with the foot-tapping music it's keep you connected with the screenplay. Direction is good and cinematography is great.

To be honest Baby Driver is a unique concept in the heist-movie genre and we can see some more of the movies following the same way.

title: A movie worth buying and that is saying a lot these days.
review:
This is an action crime heist film with a twist of a musical element to it , by that the soundtrack really plays a huge role in the plot and feel to the movie. The acting and actors are very good. To many movies waste to much time trying to make you care for the love interest the way the the main character does when really it's an obvious movie troupe , it's one of the big reasons i like this movie. That being said the movie still has heart

The last 3rd of the movie does take you out of a joy ride of a movie this is but not enough to dislike it. Also i'm pretty sure every heist movie either ends with everyone getting away or ending where most (including) the main character dies. This movie gives you both and is the reason the last 3rd is a bit messy but keeps the action going at a fast pace that it doesn't really give you time till after the movie to think about the short falls of the movie.

Overall it's just a fun movie.

title: Stylish car chase action film
review:
It was the first time for me to watch an Edgar Wright film. Above all, I was very impressed by his style, the meticulous direction and editing. The use of bright colors distinguishes this from many crime films which tend to be dark and dim.

The sound and music have a significant role in the film, because they represent Baby's hearing. You will notice how delicately each sound is arranged. And it's kind of ambiguous that the songs played in the film are soundtrack songs chosen by the directer, and also songs chosen by Baby on his iPod, either way to express his emotions.

Story is about Baby's wish to get out from the illegal job, and the criminal organization that does not let him to go. But it seems to me Baby is not just a victim of the exploitation of the criminals, because the reason he has gotton into the world is partly that he has talent as a getaway driver. He seems to fight more against his own nature than against the threat by the criminals. It makes this film an introverted one.

Similarly the criminal organization is not really an organization. It's just a bunch of indivisuals. Doc, Buddy, Darling and Bats, each of them has their own strong character, interesting backgound, and internal conflict.

Car chase scenes are the most exciting ones that I've ever seen. They are cheerful too, because the bright colors and uptempo songs give them some comical touch. And they are not just exciting as action, but also many important plot twists and dialogues are taken place in the cars.

title: Well executed, but becomes boring
review: Seen much better, movie starts out entertaining and it has a good plot, but kinda repetitve. It could of been done in 80 minutes...

title: A great work from Edgar Wright.
review: This is a fun and energetic film about right and wrong. I recommend because its very funny and well made.

title: Great film
review:
As a car guy I was begging for a film like this. Modern car films are more focus on action rather cars. The driving scenes in this movie are very well made and although some aspects are a little too much, the overall product is really good.
The story is also a good one. They tell us the background of the main character through out the film and "romance" is developed in a "not too cliche" manner.
Overall good film and I highly recommend it .

title: The best movie ever of 2017. 9/10
review:
There is no movie more amazing, more intense, more original and more awesome than Edgar Wright's baby driver (2017). I know I might be exaggerating but for real, this is one of the best movies I've seen in the last few years. It has a great and original script idea. The whole tone of the movie is intriguing, fun and fast. If you thought "The Fast and The Furious" franchise has no content, you won't be disappointed with this killer heist movie. Ansel Elgort delivers his best performance in a movie. His acting and coolness on screen is amazing. I'm attached to his character. Lily James is stunning in her performance. Kevin Spacey is fantastic as a mob guy who runs the whole operation. Jamie Foxx is annoying but that's the whole point with his character and that's why I loved him. Jon Bernthal, Jon Hamm and Eisa Gonzales are fabulous and great actors. Hands down to Edgar Wright on the writing and directing of the movie. He made the best out of it. I think for the whole movie I had absolutely no problem. Nothing bad to say about it, I enjoyed most sequences although I can point on a few things that bothered me:
1) when baby was interrogated by Doc and the rest of the team, after they went to his house and stole all his records. Baby is facing a big challenge. The crew members of the heist are accusing him of betrayal and calling him a "snitch", throughout the movie baby's character is silent and cool but I was hoping for him to get more mad. Instead of playing one of his records to show he is just making music, why can't he defend himself a little more?. His adoptive father was probably hit, his girlfriend is in danger, why I don't see his character changing a bit and turning from cool mode to bad mode?. I really hoped in this particular scene where he is in danger and being questioned. That we will see him all hothead.
That's it, that's how I enjoyed the movie, and it is rare cause I have nothing else bad to say about it.
The soundtrack is probably the main feature here, every song is a masterpiece and fits so well into every scene or sequence. Every scene has a song that matches perfectly for the tone and genre of the movie. One of the best soundtracks ever made for a movie. My favorite moment of the film has to be opening sequence of baby walking to get coffee for the others. This scene is just so well made, the one shot filming of the scene that focuses on baby, the song "Harlem Shuffle" by Bob and Earl in the background is fantastic, and all the words of the song on the background was a nice touch: when baby slides, the words "right here" appear on the floor (genius). I wish I can talk more about this movie but maybe it's better to highly recommend this film, a nice, furious and thriller packed heist movie. With an original idea. This movie should have won:
Best picture, Best original screenplay, Best leading actor for Ansel Elgort, Best supporting actor for Jamie Foxx and of course Best soundtrack. That's not an oscar category but it delivers my point.

title: A great movie in short
review: Cars, action, Guns, good performances, good Cinematography, Fast paced, Great music , Good storyline, engaging screenplay ...what else is needed for entertainment. One of the coolest ,smartest and enjoyable movies to come out in recent times.

title: It's a fun ride, I mean literally
review:
What works:
  • clever and humorous script
  • sound editing and mixing
  • chase scenes are great, engaging and fun
What does not work: -over the top crime scenarios and heists, but afterall it's a movie and it's acceptable Final verdict: Recommended.

title: A fun ride that loses a bit at the end
review:
Baby Driver is about a young kid named Baby (Ansel Elgort), who is a talented getaway driver for bank heists doctored up by Doc (Kevin Spacey). Baby is "a good kid forced into a bad situation", working these jobs until he can pay back Doc, from whom he stole something.

Doc, however, likes Baby, and considers him his good luck charm, so that even after Baby has paid back what he took from Doc, Doc has him do another job. Baby is teamed up with Griff (Jon Hamm), Darling (Eiza GonzÃ¡lez), and Bats ( Jamie Foxx) to steal from the postal office.

Meanwhile, Baby develops a relationship with a waitress named Debora (Lily James). Both want to start a new life, but Baby gets thrown into this gig. He plans to run away with her, but the plan goes awry.

Pros: * The music. * The scene in the beginning where Baby is dance/walking to a song, all the while with the graffiti syncing every now and then with the words in the song. * Solid acting by everyone with Elgort and Foxx being standouts. * good chemistry between Elgort and James. * "Who doesn't like hats"? Not sure why I found that line so funny, but I did. * The playful "Easter egg" scenes like the song sync mentioned above, the dryer scene, the guns syncing with music,

Cons: * movie seemed to go a bit long near the end. The whole thing with Griff just got a bit unbelievable after a while. * it was hard to believe, with all the things that happened, that they would still go forward with the post office heist. * hard to believe Deborah would have left with Baby. She hardly knows him. Couple meetings in the diner, share a few songs, do laundry, have a dinner and she's ready to run away with him and potentially be an accomplice? Didn't seem believable.

Solid 7. I enjoyed it and wouldn't mind watching it again to pick up on some of the things I missed, but I just wished they cut about 10 minutes near the end and that Debora choosing to run off with Baby was a bit more believable.

title: Entertaining
review: Don't watch if you are looking for a movie with deep message or emotion.This movie entertained me that's it.Nothing more.Good movie to spend time with

title: An underrated film
review: Amazing movie from the director of Shaun of the dead. This is, in my opinion Edgar Wright's best work, the acting is spot on, the chase scenes are perfectly shot, and the score is amazing. The film features standout performances by Kevin Spacey and Jamie Foxx, who by the way makes a great villain, the ending was perfect and I am definitely hoping for a sequel.

title: edgar wright is my god.
review: All you need is one killer track, one of the best musical movies.

title: All Time Movie
review:
Baby Driver tops the charts for me - by far.

The filmmaking is excellent in this one and the introverted main character in a high intensity situation makes it all the more appealing.

I don't usually rate 9 stars, so I can definitely say I'm thankful for this entertaining film.

title: Good for action
review: One of the best driving action flick, Lily james is lovely, all actors have done good but plot near the end doesn't makes much sense.

title: BELL-BOTTOMS!
review:
The fact that Edgar Wright made a movie to fit a soundtrack in his head is phenomenal! The timing, beats and shot transitions are all Wright genius!

The conclusion is a bit lame. The never ending "bad guy" is a little too Halloween-esque. But, I guess you need extended drama for the third act.

title: All-around enjoyable ( C+Movie ) My Ratings 8/10
review: Baby Driver is just plain fun! The acting, the driving, the soundtrack? It all fits in this fantastic thrill of a movie. That's it. That's all I have to say about it. It's a blast!

title: Moving!
review: Great movie! Best part was when Jamie Foxx gets speared! Loved it.

title: "A Action, drama and musical Journey."
review: A intense action, musical and drama journey through the life of baby. This movie is unlike anything you have probably seen yet and you will thank yourself for watching this. Every element in this film makes sense and ties together for a satisfying and epic 1 hour and 45 minutes.

title: Sick.
review: Sick. A film that shows a phenomenal demonstration of tension and music and drama. It all collaborates to a film and entices the movies viewer. I literally love every scene in this movie. To me almost nothing about this movie is bad at all.

title: Best car chase/ heist film in MANY years
review: Arguably one of the best films so far this year. Its like watching a Fast and Furious movie with a great soundtrack and a plot that is realistic.

title: Wright's Masterpiece
review:
Edgar Wright's Baby Driver is a triumph. Director Edgar Wright took 22 years to create this film from idea to sensation. Baby Driver is a thriller, comedy, crime film set in modern day Atlanta about an orphan with a gift for driving, which is perfect for heist leader, Doc. Baby (played by Ansel Elgort) never does a job without the perfect playlist. Everything in the movie comes together to create nothing short of a masterpiece. For years the Fast and Furious movies have dominated the driving/car genre, but Baby Driver definitely made a big impression.
Baby Driver not only has multiple action scenes that will have you on the edge of your seat, it also plays with the idea of good vs bad. Baby has been working for Doc since he could see over the dashboard. He's supposed to do one last job, but we all know that will get messy. He falls in love with a beautiful waitress named Deborah (played by Lily James), they bond over their love of music and the idea of an open road. He wants to get out of the crime business so he can drive off with her. Baby shows us that good and bad isn't as black and white as it may seem. Wright made many genius directing decisions that makes it clear that people's actions are not the only indicator of a person's goodness.
The movie moves very quickly and I was left wondering how two people could fall in love so quickly, but for centuries this has been a trend, for example Romeo and Juliet. Although the love story moves quickly, it doesn't take away from the movie and conveys the theme of good vs bad very well.
The editing and scenery were (dare I say) perfection. A film having so many car chase scenes can seem choppy or get boring if the scenes are too long, but Wright did a beautiful job of shooting from multiple angles and editing it to grab our attention and keep us engaged.
Sound in this movie is a major component. Baby Driver is almost a musical because of how vital the music is throughout the film. Every scene is so much better because of the music choices. Baby has a specific song for each job and timing is everything. In one scene the other people on the team didn't get out of the car on que, so he had to restart the song, which was not only funny, but showed us how important music is to Baby. He has ringing in his ears from a car crash when he was little, so he uses music to drown it out. The music is played from Baby's point of view, so we can hear what he hears, which is absolutely genius. When the music stops, we hear the ringing in Baby's ears which not only engages us in the film, but brings us closer to Baby.
Wright does an incredible job making an award worthy film (that has won six awards). This film is an absolute success. It's a must see that will have you wanting to watch it again right after finishing it.

title: Entertaining movie in the Transporter vein of action films
review:
As someone who thoroughly enjoyed the first two Transporter films (third was meh), Baby Driver was a refreshing addition to that genre of action films. Ansel's character is fantastic, and while Kevin Spacey has since fallen from grace, his character was enjoyable as well. John Hamm and Jamie Foxx played their supporting roles well.

Overall, worth the watch.

title: Wright at his best
review: Masterfully edited and scored, Baby Driver tells a classic tale with a very Wright twist.

title: MUSIC FOR YOUR EYES
review:
SPOILER-FREE

If you like music, action, crime, heist, car chases, and classic love story then this movie is for you. The movie has it all. It's the perfect mashup of all that component. That first 6 minutes of Jon Spencer Blues Explosion soundtrack mesh with the action alone is worth the price of admission.

As soon as I heard that this is an Edgar Wright's directed movie, I was immediately drawn to it. I admit, I had my doubts though. I wasn't a fan of the newly-replaced Robert Pattinson's throne of teenage heartthrob, Ansel Elgort. But he does his job good enough as Baby, a young man with a hum in the drums as Doc (Kevin Spacey) put it. He portrays the character well in my opinion. Nothing out of the ordinary though.

Maybe some wouldn't notice, but the movie is like a musical in some kind of way. Well, almost. It's very well choreographed to the sountrack. 2 scenes that stood out for me was the opening 6 minutes scene, and the Tequila song in the warehouse scene. All that effort should always be commended.

Now, for the technical point, First, the cinematography. It's the usual of what you would se in an Edgar Wright's movie. A few scenes even consists of some long shots. Secondly, the car chases scene sequence. That's definitely the highlight of the movie. If you've watched Edgar Wright's previous movies, you can already imagine all the action in it. Mind you, they're all real. Well, at least most of it. Edgar Wright has confirmed that the movie only uses 10% CGI for the stunts, which means most of the stunts are done on set. Which in today's standard is a highly unusual choice but you can see why. It makes the scenes more authentic and an absolute guarantee will make the movie timeless in a few decades.

The only negatives from the movie for me is the antagonist and the climax. To me, the choice for the main antagonist isn't strong enough for me. They presented a good choice for them, but the final reveal is just not to my liking. Also, the climax action scene aren't as strong as other Edgar Wright's movie. It feels a bit anti-climactic in a way. I feel like the movie could do a little better for the conclusion.

But, all in all a pretty good movie. It's what you would expect in an Edgar Wright movie, action, comedy, good choreography, awesome cinematography and scene transitions, a simple settings, good storytelling and a bit of a romantic subplot. If you love The John Spencer Blues Explosion, Simon & Garfunkel, The Foundations, The Beach Boys, Queen, Beck, REM, Barry White or Danger Mouse, then this is movie for you. I dare you to not be entertained by this movie. Cause it's very hard not to be.

END OF REVIEW.

title: Great movie. Pure fun.
review:
Great movie, pure action and fun,
great sound work, wonderful performances by Jamie Foxx, John Hamm and Ansel Elgort, spectacular soundtrack. What more do you need? Popcorn and soda? Ok. It's coming. Have fun.
Please, Hollywood, go back to schedule Kevin Spacey. It is not possible to give up so much talent because the guy likes sex. Stop the damn hypocrisy.

title: I watched the movie and where is Jon bentham?
review: Good movie and there is missing every bad people dies that great

title: A must see!
review: Never get tired of watching this film it's full of all different genres perfect for the whole family great plot great acting great film definitely recommend this

title: Excellent
review: Funny, exciting, entertaining, with an amazing soundtrack and terrifically directed, "Baby Driver" is a new heist classic

title: An Honest Review
review:
I guess this is one of those movies that you're not supposed to like because meh politics and meh hipster and meh outrage culture and... reasons that really make no sense and are ultimately meaningless.

At least that is what a good bulk of the negative reviews say.

So let's not talk about meh politics and focus on the movie instead.

My wife put it on, and I have never heard of it. I, legit, thought she was talking about Simon and Garfunkel when she started talking about it. "Do you want to watch Baby Driver?"

Honest mistake, she's part Guatemalan, her English isn't all that great... watch, listen to, whatever.

Anyway, I was in the kitchen cooking and I missed the first part... but I was digging the music.

In fact I was digging the music so much that I started going to and from the living room, just because the soundtrack was that compelling. A great mixture of old and new.

And then it was Kevin Spacey and Jamie Foxx, and you really want to see that. Both of them can turn a theatrical trick or two when they want to, and it always kind of seems that Spacey always wants to... and the soundtrack.

And then when I finished cooking and we started eating in front of the television, I really started noticing the ringing when the music wasn't playing. And that was irritating... until my wife filled me in on the back story and then it was an "ah-ha," moment of coolness. It was fairly compelling that they did that, and ran with it like they did.

And, I can't be absolutely positive, but it didn't like it had that much CGI, and that is a plus. It looked incredibly real, like the good old days, so even through you are watching a movie filtered through an Ipod... it had an authentic action movie feel to it.

Over all, it was incredibly enjoyable fun... and that is why you watch movies like this, right? Because they are fun?

So, 10 stars, mission accomplished, it was one heck of a fun film.

title: Pure Perfection
review: Simple, fun action, great romance aspect and a respectable cast. The best movie I have ever seen.

title: A Car Thief Struggling to Pay Off a Debt
review: "Doc" (Kevin Spacey) is an unscrupulous criminal with an appetite for large sums of money which he satisfies by crafting elaborate robberies and then assembling a team to carry out his schemes. So when a skilled car thief by the name of "Baby" (Ansel Elgort) steals his car containing a bag full of stolen loot, Doc is not one to simply let it slide. To that extent, Doc demands that Baby reimburse him by becoming his getaway driver on a set number of future bank heists to make up for his lost revenue. Left with few other satisfactory options, Baby agrees and anxiously awaits the day his debt will finally be paid in full. Unfortunately, in his greed Doc has become too reliant upon Baby and doesn't want to let him go so easily. Now rather than reveal any more I will just say that this was a decent action film which consisted of solid acting and a pretty good cast. It does, however, lose some momentum toward the end but even so I enjoyed this movie for the most part and for that reason I have rated it accordingly. Slightly above average.

title: Style over substance
review: Not the smartest action movie I have seen, but entertaining and stylish.

title: it is fun. Thats it
review: You are not going to find the next The Godfather and i think it doesnt pretend that. It is what it is. A fun movie to expend a good 2 hours.

title: Great story.
review: Finally something diffrent to watch! Original idea, movie was well made and produced.

title: "Feel the rhythm, don't be scared"
review: Great heartfelt movie that lets you look as deep as you want to. A world pretty much seen through the eyes of a young man who colours his tainted world with classic tunes to help fill the void of his deceased mother. There's not a lot of character background stories but I like not over complicating it without seeming shallow. It's a time slice if you will. I'd watch this over fast n furious any day of the week.

title: Good movie
review: The movie has a brilliant beginning and great music selection. Some scenes are very spectacular, the plot could be better in the second part.

title: Excellent with only a word!!
review: I watched best story movie for last years. Yeeah babyy!

title: Damn near perfect
review: Incredibly well mixed and edited and brilliantly shot. I'll watch anything Wright does

title: Good heist thriller
review: I saw baby driver for my crush lily James but eventually got fascinated with its plot. A good story filled with car chase, peppy music and a roller coaster last act. My lily James didn't disappoint me. She is very beautiful and had a good chemistry with baby. The actual show stealer was Jamie fox. On the whole, baby driver is an enjoyable film.

title: Very good
review: I really enjoyed this movie but I can't help but to feel the director lost his way meaning....the movie was brilliant but it could have been most better than what is actually was. Worth the watch ? Absolutely yes ! I can't say to much incase someone reads this and as not seen the movie.

title: You have to put headphones on
review:
This movie is awesome, but you have to turn off your Surround Sound and plug in your headphones.

It is great to hear the sound as the actor would hear the sound e.g. the intro with the tinnitus 😍.

title: One of the most creative and fun movies I've seen.
review: This movie is very stylized, and a lot like other Edgar Wright films. It is fast paced, entertaining, and very stylized. You know every character, and what they want. Baby is not very likeable or relatable, but for this, it works. The main "gimmick" of this movie is that there is music playing during the movie, and everything in the movie is in sync with the music. The story makes sense and moves forward. It never really slows down, and that's okay. The only issue I have with the movie is the end, and if you have watched it, you'll know why. All the actors are great, especially John Hamm, Kevin Spacey, and Jamie Foxx. Ansel Elgort is alright in this movie, he's not terrible, he's not awful, he's okay. I don't love him, I don't hate him. If you like fast movies with style and good soundtracks (mainly the Guardians of the Galaxy), then you'll like this movie.

title: Okay narrative, amazing editing
review:
Best editing I've seen in a film in a long time. Definitely holds up with Hot Fuzz, Scott Pilgrim VS The World and Shaun of the Dead.

I found myself losing a bit of interest during some of the more heavy dialectical scenes, due to the mediocre script, but enjoyed the film quite a bit. If you didn't check this one out yet, definitely make sure to.

Rating 7.8

title: Mediocre
review:
I heard a lot about this movie and I've been wanting to watch it lately, so ...
Baby driver is a simple movie, not pretentious with a simple plot line, few parts where it makes you chuckle (not laugh) and I expected more.
Honestly as soon as I saw flashbacks of baby's past life I got triggered, I hate flashbacks but thank god it was only a couple of them.
It's also a simple story of baby being in debt and participating in robberies.
overall it's just a mediocre movie

title: Trying to be everything and nothing
review: It's like the director tries to merge an idea of "Drive" meeting "Oceans Eleven" and the result is disappointing.

title: Great driving movie
review: Thrilling plot, and quality scenes, filmed in a great way!

title: Loved it.
review:
I actually loved this. Now wonder it had so many awards and nominations!
Didn't want it to end.
Main character Baby was interesting enough that they could go on to make a sequel.

title: A love letter to the vehicular action genre
review: Edgar Wright's 5th feature-length film, and arguably his most commercially successful outside of the UK, is an action-packed, musical whirlwind of explosive fights, obscure references and incredible cinematography. To call any of the music-synced scenes anything less than stellar would be an insult to Wright's clear passion for music, with meticulously framed panning shots that must've taken such painstaking effort that I don't think I've ever seen anything quite like it in modern cinema. Baby, played by Ansel Elgort, is an endearing character who drives (pun intended) the heart of this film, being genuine fun to watch as he runs around as our eyes in these various heist operations, as well as tugging on our heartstrings in the film's more down-to-earth romance core. Arguably this is the weakest point of the film, with the relationship between Baby and his love interest Debora being very surface level, with lots of emotional beats relying on how much you like this duo, which this film doesn't 100% justify. Though its substance is very baseline, with "mindless action" to get your adrenaline rushing and "simple romance" to get you to feel, the style in this film is not to be glossed over. Truly a marvel for the eyes and ears, this movie plays into a very specific aesthetic and never lets go, hues of pinks and whites overlapping with the sound of Focus and The Damned, keeping the audience invested in this bubblegum thriller through it's many twists and turns. Overall, although it isn't Wright's best, you'd be remiss to miss out on this film, especially if you are a fan of music and/or action cinema.

title: It's good, but not Edgar Wright good
review:
Baby Driver turns out to be Edgar Wright's blandest, most forgettable film yet, as much of his directing flare is pushed aside with the main gimmick of the film placed primarily on the notion that the action is edited in time with the music. This is a fun gimmick for sure, but is it enough to keep me invested? Am I going to remember it 10 years from now? Definitely not.

Edgar's normal talent of visual storytelling and progression is nearly gone from this film, as is the memorable, witty, relatable main character, as Baby, apart from having tenitits, and being a remixer, is by far his blandest protagonist yet. In fact, the rest of the characters are bland too, with a cliche group of crooks, with Jamie Foxx's character being the most over the top, predictable, and least interesting of the bunch, and Kevin Spacey being another typical stern mob boss character, who takes a complete 180 in the climax for the sake of the narrative, which there really isn't anything to - the story feels empty. Nothing of note happens here, and that'd be okay if the characters were memorable, but they just aren't. Not to mention the completely undeveloped love story embedded in here.

While I could contently watch it again due to the well edited action, and John Ham's performance, Baby Driver is definitely Edgar Wright's least interesting project yet, and really doesn't have a lot to offer in terms of character or plot.

title: my notes
review: Very well made movie on all fronts. exciting with some good action and lots of great scenes and moments (1 viewing)

title: A go home and Google soundtrack.
review: Here's my review of baby driver. So baby driver is directed by Edgar Wright , the genius behind the Scott pilgrim movie . Imagine the cop chase from grand theft auto with a little bit of drama , that's what this movie is. From start to finish , this movie is a joy ride . The dialogues are well written and there were some pretty solid one liners. Now , the soundtrack in this movie is really good , its one of those movies where you come back home and Google for the song in a particular scene . All characters in this movie were really good , there were no unwanted characters or subplots and it stuck to its story. In the end , baby driver is a unique movie with great action , likeable characters , no cliches and a go home and Google soundtrack.

title: Nice cinematography and nice music in a solid all-fun action movie.
review: Baby is a weird, quiet guy with a passion for music who works occasionally as a getaway driver. That's the story of "Baby Driver", a film that's using wellknown plot elements and twists in a bit too long action-packed heist movie. It looks good, has entertainment value, and some fun characters.

title: Flawless
review: I'm not a major fan of car chasing scenes, I usually turn out, however I was glued to every movement in every single action scene. Utterly addictive, I can't wait to watch it again. I don't understand how anyone could rate this less than 10/10. One of the most original films I've seen in years.

title: Just straight up fun
review: So many reviews talking about cliches and self indulgence and yeah this movie is filled with those. But that's what I love so much about it! It's so full of energy and music and familiar characters that just fill me with nostalgia. Writing is great, the scenes are so fun to watch truly one of Wrights best.

title: Oh Baby
review: This is an exciting, stylish car chase flick. The driving choreography and cinematography are great. Jon Hamm plays a great villain, but I wish there had been more of Jon Bernthal. The real star of the film is the sound design. There are great, classic songs throughout, and the action is often synchronized to the music. Debora being willing to wait up to 25 years for Baby after they went on like 3 dates seems a little odd, but that's movie love I guess. Also Buddy being virtually invincible was a little silly. Great performances, and very well-cast.

title: not as good as Drive 2011
review: This movie was well directed in an artistic way,but more about the music than the escape driver.

title: "Ladies and gentlemen, rock and roll"
review:
The first words spoken on MTV!
I was waiting for a cameo by Nina Blackwood.
At times this felt like an 80s video.
I get a Rainman feel off of Baby. Instead of cards and toothpicks his special skills are driving and making music.
A lot of style. A lot of coolness. A lot of excentricities.
Not a bad movie. Kevin Spacey has played this role many times.

title: Expert directing by Edgar Wrigh
review: Amazingly the young lad who is the getaway driver is credible in the role. Well played

title: A unique film!
review: I love this film because it has a take on action that is quite unique. You feel a connection to the protagonist, Baby, and you feel sympathy for him despite the fact that he is part of a criminal operation. The ending is a bit unbelievable, which lets it down slightly, but nonetheless it is a heart-warming and yet action-filled film.

title: Baby Driver is a Masterpiece!
review: I don't think you can ask for anymore then what Baby Driver delivers!! I was on the edge of my seat and more entertained by this film than most films with a budget of $200 million or more! I don't need to put any spoilers on this review, but I just think this is perfection in the world of entertainment. There is just so many surprises and things that caught me off guard. The acting was fantastic from everyone. Sure there's been thousands of heist movies before and this is certainly in the same genre as Oceans11 and movies like that but it just really seems different and original in a time where it feels like every movie being made is a remake. I could bring up certain plot points, but I think I'd be doing this movie a disservice. This writer and director deserves all the credit for taking us on the emotional rollercoaster!

title: Came for Driving, left with music.
review: Baby Driver is a great film that covers the life of a heist getaway driver. It shows the lows of the lows, and the highs of the highs. It's great to see Ansel Egort's character so well developed and Lily James is a perfect Bonnie to his Clyde. The music side of the story fits so well with the film and I found myself singing along at times. It also played well to the background action. The film is also a perfect addition to Netflix's array of films. Great film, well made.

title: Pure film art
review: I have to say that Baby Driver is the best movie I have seen in years. When a main character is called Baby you just know that you are in for quite a ride. And this movie delivers everything with masterful acting, spectacularly action scenes and bits off comedy, that just is all around amazingly done. The movie gets almost a full rating from me cause it can drag a bit through the film, but that doesn't stop it from getting a 9 star. Well done.

title: Great movie all around.
review:
Baby driver is what you get when you put Edgar Wright in charge of an ordinary heist movie. It's fast paced, has terrific action scenes and manages to incorporate a human element to the whole thing.

The story deals with the titular Baby who due to an accident suffered as a child has tinnitus. To combat this he's constantly listening to music on his headphones. He's also one of the most gifted drivers out there so in order to pay off a debt to a big time gangster, he's become the getaway driver.

Add to this a bunch of colorful characters that go along with him on these heists, a human element story where young Baby is enamored with not only making music from taped conversations but also what he plays during his getaways and the girl that he's trying to get to know.

Strong performances all around from Kevin Spacey as the big time gangster, Jon Hamm as one of the bank robbers and Lily James as the girl that reminds Baby of his mother. And of course a lot of those little touches that Edgar Wright likes to put into all his movies.

I can't recommend this movie enough.

title: What a movie, watched it twice in the past two days
review: I had a lot of hype for this movie and have considered buying the dvd many times. But I was delighted when it appeared on my Netflix. It stuck on and I feel I am going binge watch it. Would highly recommend this amazing movie. It's definitely my new favourite.

title: A bit too long ending doesn't ruin this awesome movie
review:
Edgar Wright's sense of style is just excellent. I loved the movie from start to the near end. All the scenes are audiovisual candy and the character interaction is so much fun. The cast is great and they dedicated themselves to their characters very well. I burst out laughing several times through the movie. The soundtrack is one of the better ones I've ever heard.

My only complaint is just that the movie really should've ended with Jon Hamm falling into the flames. Jon Hamm endlessly coming back was a bit comical in the wrong sense. I don't think that Baby would be so stupid that he'd turn himself in after killing people and doing several armed robberies. Five year prison sentence was very generous on him "just because he was nice". It'd been perfect if Baby and Debora would've just driven into the sunset and roll credits. It'd fit the personal style of Baby Driver perfectly.

Nevertheless, this was really one of the better movies I've ever seen, I'll give this a very solid 8/10, maybe even 9/10 on rewatch.

title: WATCH IT FOR THE MUSIC
review: The sountrack is the coolest part of this film! The music fits well and is what designs the whole movie. The movie itself has good potential but unfortunately the plot ends up a bit thin. Altogether, I wouldn't skip the movie - it is easy and good enough entertainment and if the music is good...then what's the problem?

title: Leave your brain at home and have a great time.
review:
I must admit, this movie got me emotional for a bit. It has good action, the car chases were really good but sort of lacking taking into account the theme of the movie. Don't question the characters' motivations for the most important actions because you will be disappointed finding they make no sense. Baby, the main character, fails to put others before himself obeying his greedy boss. He does have nice moments and an overall wish not to be involved in the bad, but he does it anyway. The ending just quite doesn't cut it as a convincing transformation. Also, 'Darling' is a spectacularly unconvincing character there to smile for the camera.
With all that said, I am going to make the unreasonable decision and give the movie 9 stars. Simply because I enjoyed it.

title: Do not listen to all the negativity
review: I found it worth watching just for the car chases and the sound track. Ok the plot wasn't that great and some of the characters lacked substance. Much better than the fast and furious and more believable. Watch this space for Ansel Elgort I think he has a bright future.

title: If you are a music lover, it's your action film.
review:
A perfectly done combination of music and action, Baby Driver it's Edgar Wright's baby, as it was on the works for about two decades. I like his camera work and the long sequences are my favorite. Second act is a bit slower than the first and it kinda tones down the effect of the first act which is ka-boom! Still, a good, enjoyable movie with many well executed, fast paced action scenes. Bonus, it's full of good, really good music.
Don's miss it! 8/10

title: Adrenaline + Love : No consistence of characters's behaviors
review:
Typical bank-heist-poor-kid movie. But it will keep you busy and happy.

So, there's this teenaged kid who is great on the wheels, and who listens to music all the time. He's got special tracks for every mood, and different i-pods for every day. Cool kid... And you start to associate with him. Adrenaline rushes as you see him driving like crazy.

In the flashback, it is shown that the kid's father was abusive and that the parents got killed when they met an accident as they were fighting while the mother was was driving. The kid was in the passenger seat and therefore always hears some noise... That explains his love for music. Does it?

There's a heist planning BOSS. And the kid is stuck with him as driver for the bank-heists he plans. Explanation for him being stuck is all over the place.

The kid finds a girl who falls for him. He has, in the meantime, paid off the BOSS for whatever he was stuck with him for.

But the BOSS wants him to continue anyway. Becausethats what the evil bosses are supposed to do. A new team is formed to rob the Post-office. There's this hot-headed guy in the new team who goes crazy... Killing people he is not supposed to kill, and doing petty crimes on the way.
